Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This extraordinary wine offers a tantalizing, bold, black-pepper aroma that leads to deep, just-ripe black-fruit flavors and an array of clove, espresso and earth accents that give it delicious complexity. It is tightly wrapped in fine-grained tannins at this point, but will bring out more complexity and smoothness with time. Best from 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2018 Valenti Ranch Syrah (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fantastically fresh and snappy aromas of cracked pepper, black raspberry, purple flowers and nori wrap show on the show-stopping nose of this bottling. There's a feathery acidity that floats across the palate, sprinkling lovely lavender, rosemary, menthol and crisp pluot flavors all the way into a delicate finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Madson 2019 Ascona Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This winery's bottlings only seem to grow more interesting and elegant with time, and this vintage, which includes 11% Viognier, is riding its potentially extended peak. Aromas of nori wrap, peppercorn and seashore wrap around singed boar and muddled red fruit on the nose, while the palate pops with dried cranberry, orange rind, seared lamb and hibiscus.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Boscoe 2015 La Fai Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling from what's now known as Alisos Canyon begins with a tremendous display of cracked pepper on the nose, which also features elderberry and charred wood. That peppercorn spice pops on the palate, adding a savory kick to the roasted black-raspberry and black-plum flavors, with soy, toasted wood and lavender also in play.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Glunz 2018 White Hawk Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of lilac and white pepper waft across the nose of this bottling, giving depth and life to the acai and other dark-purple-fruit aromas. There's extreme complexity to the lavender and rosemary blossoms elements of the palate, where a rich boysenberry-sorbet and crushed herb core is framed by sticky tannins. Much more to come here. Drink 2024–2033.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jaffurs 2018 Upslope Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This luxurious and deeply concentrated wine is easy to love, from the first whiff of bursting ripe black cherries and blueberries to the saturated palate of almost jammy black-fruits and dark chocolate, to the lingering, generous finish. It is quite full bodied, boasting melted tannins and a mouthfilling richness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2017 Syrah (Red Hills)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Potent and polished, this full-bodied wine includes 7% Viognier. It sprinkles cinnamon, ginger and black pepper over delicious, dark blackberry and blueberry flavors for an especially tasty and spicy profile. Fine-grained tannins and a rich mouthfeel keep it going through a lingering finish. Best through at least 2026.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prospect 772 2018 The Brawler Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Peppercorn, braised lamb, lavender, baking-spice and dark-berry aromas make for an authentically cool-climate experience on the nose of this bottling. Iodine and bloody meat flavors meet with elderberry on the savory sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kynsi 2017 Syrah (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though David Haskell's Syrahs aim for elegance, they are also quite fun and engaging. Light in the glass, this one, which includes 7% Viognier, starts with aromas of fresh red currant, raspberry and wild sage. The palate zips with energy, flashing white pepper spice against flavors of cherry compote and orange rind.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Boscoe 2017 La Fai Kimsey Vineyard Syrah-Viognier (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A sensational value, this is a dark, aromatic and richly fruity wine, with potent flavors of roasted fruits and scorched earth. It avoids bitterness throughout a long finish, laced with anise and a hint of lemon. The power and balance are exceptional.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Quady North 2017 4-2,A Syrah (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lavender and lilac aromas mesh into blueberry and cracked pepper on the cohesive nose of this bottling. Light pepper and game flavors snuggle around the brisk elderberry and purple-flower aspects of the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Derby 2017 Derby Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)

Description: Opening in an unmistakable whiff of game and garrigue, this hearty, full-bodied wine is richly layered in black cherry and berry, with a length of tannin. Tobacco leaf, black pepper and leathery texture add to the rounded intensity, balanced by nuanced acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thirty-Seven 2017 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Voluminous yet fresh, this full-bodied Syrah highlights ripe, perfumed plum and blackberry flavors shaded by graphite, cedar and crushed peppercorns. Matured in a mix of concrete and large-format oak barrels, it's a supple, pure-fruited red edged by fine, silky tannins and a spicy licorice finish. It drinks beautifully in youth but should hold through 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Emmanuel Darnaud 2018 Les Troix Chênes  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From a new line of wines by Edgar Torres, this bottling begins with charred lamb and beef aromas as well as dark berry, black pepper and singed violet on the nose. Roasted boysenberry and oaky vanilla meet with peppery spices on the palate, which is quite rich but layered in texture and herb.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Songs 2018 Dreams Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This sure-to-be long-lasting expression of this historic vineyard kicks off with snappy aromas of black raspberry, white pepper and charred meat on the nose. There is a fresh and edgy quality to the hearty palate, full of charred berries, black pepper and rounded violet flavors. It opens steadily with air. Drink now through 2038.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jaffurs 2018 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is the winery's reserve, and a shining example of the exceptional quality of Applegate Valley Syrah. Dense and compact fruit flavors of blueberry and blackberry, accented with barrel flavors from aging in 50% new French oak. Licorice and coffee liqueur are in the mix, and the wild yeast ferment adds further texture and length.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Quady North 2016 Mae's Vineyard Flagship Syrah (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh aromas of black raspberry, violet and wisteria get sprinkled with white pepper and wet earth on the nose of this bottling from a historic vineyard deep in the valley. Buoyant acidity and sandy tannins frame the sip, where blueberry and lavender flavors stay fun and fresh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Scar of the Sea 2019 Rancho Sisquoc Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: David Haskell's elegant take on Syrah, in this case with 5% Viognier, presents crisp yet dark cranberry and pomegranate aromas as well as white pepper, green peppercorns and wild thyme on the nose. The herbal hints of sage and juniper show on the sip as well, where a slightly candied cherry fruit also pops out.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Boscoe 2016 La Fai Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

Description: The top wine from this estate, it got its name when it was created and Syrah was not fully approved in Alentejo. Things move on, but the name of this rich, structured and impressive wine lives on. The wood aging and the rich berry fruits have blended beautifully into a wine that is mature but that has by no means lost its rich fruitiness. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Cortes de Cima 2013 Incógnito Syrah (Alentejano)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of dark berry, white pepper, violet pastis and rich baking spice on warm pastry arise from the nose of this bottling, which includes 14% Counoise. It's full throated on the palate, loaded with blackberry pie, mace and wood spice. The palate continues to open with air. Drink now through 2033.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kukkula 2018 Noir Syrah (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Snappy black-raspberry and boysenberry aromas are dusted in light licorice, black-pepper and pie-crust tones on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely complex, with a baked fruit core that's lifted by thyme and pepper, as acidity and herbs cut through the richness.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jaffurs 2018 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, blackberry, ground pepper, blue flowers and mocha emerge from the glass. Elegantly structured, the velvety palate offers blackberry compote, fleshy black cherry, French oak and toasted nuts alongside smooth, enveloping tannins. It closes on notes of blood orange and coffee bean. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Isole e Olena 2016 Collezione Privata Syrah (Toscana)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Firm, somewhat lean and tightly wound with tannins, this wine fermented with 50% whole clusters. It boasts complex earth, black pepper, beef jus and blackberry flavors on a grippy texture and will need extra time to mature in the bottle. Best to drink from 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2018 Perli Vineyard Syrah (Mendocino Ridge)

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoothly integrated aromas of cassis, dark violet, lilac and grilled meats show on the nose of this bottling. There's a pleasantly gritty tone to the tannins, which frame the ripe and accessible blackberry-sorbet and purple-flower flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vincent Vineyards 2018 Family Reserve Syrah (Los Olivos District)

Description: The estate on the slopes of Mont Saint-Victoire in Provence has produced this powerful and rich wine. Structure goes with dense black fruits, touches of licorice and dark tannins. The weight of the wine is redeemed by good acidity that comes through and freshens everything at the end. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine des Masques 2018 Exception Syrah (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This superripe, concentrated and full-bodied wine offers potent, Port-like aromas, a rich, warm texture and vivid black-fruit and dark-chocolate flavors backed by fine-grained tannins. Amazing richness and concentration are its strongest points.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prospect 772 2018 The Instigator Shake Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

Description: From a cool-climate site also planted to Pinot Noir, this brooding red is juicy in dark cherry and strawberry, with a lightness of baking spice, leather and black pepper. The body weight is balanced and smoothly round, with a fist of underlying grip.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vie Winery 2017 Canihan Vineyards Syrah (Sonoma Coast)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This inviting and velvet-textured wine shows superripe flavors of black figs, sweet plums and cooked strawberries along with relaxed tannins and a full, mouthfilling body. It doesn't need aging, so enjoy its richness now.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Spicy Vines 2017 Dragon's Kiss Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Mossy earth, damp mushrooms, gamy meat and wild-berry aromas converge on the nose of this reserve bottling. It's delicately bodied on the palate, where lavender decorates the dried berry, rusty minerality and burly meat flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kynsi 2017 Kalanna Syrah (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Geneseo District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Iron shavings, dried berries and a smoky streak show on the nose of this bottling. It's a brawny style of Syrah on the palate, full of roasted berry, mesquite, mace and nutmeg flavors, proving both bold and comforting.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pianetta 2018 Syrah (Paso Robles Geneseo District)

Description: Gamy and thickly rich in garrigue, bacon and dark berry and cherry, this is an inviting, fleshy and rounded wine, brimming in concentrated intensity. The oak cradles the fruit and body weight well, adding elements of vanilla and baking spice.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Reynoso 2016 Syrah (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark aromas of smoked and roasted black fruit and meat meet even more savory tones of teriyaki and pepper on the nose of this bottling. There's firm tension to the sip, where the rich mouthfeel carries smoky oak, vanilla and caramel flavors, with lingering mint on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh raspberry, melon, citrus peel and feijoa aromas show on the generous nose of this bottling. It's fairly ripe on the palate, with red-plum, guava and strawberry flavors, yet well constructed with ample texture.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Buttonwood Farm 2020 Rosé of Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Dense and chewy in mocha, dark cherry and black and white pepper, this red delivers varietal intensity within a balanced package of integrated acidity that helps to brighten the mood. Crushed rock, dried herb and subtle oak add to the tasty approach.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Vie Winery 2017 Petris Vineyard Bien Nacido Clone Syrah (Los Carneros)

Description: From a highly lauded vintage, this offers layers of flavor, from pure, juicy blueberry and plum fruit to fistfuls of rose and violet petals to cocoa powder, crushed stones and a savory, slightly meaty streak. It's slinky and sexy, with ultrafine, filigree tannins that sink luxuriously into the wine. The oak is present but should fade into the background soon enough. Whether this will have the longevity of other, more tightly wound Hill of Grace vintages is up for debate. For now, though, it's one hell of a treat.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Henschke 2015 Hill of Grace Shiraz (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This countywide blend is the entry-level bottling of Sashi Moorman's many Syrahs, and it's stellar. Crushed peppercorns, crumpled flowers, rainy gutters and dewy thyme give tremendous depth to the crisp black-raspberry core. The palate is fresh, herbal, spicy and firm without being overbearing, showing singed pine, tar, plum and pepper flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Piedrasassi 2018 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: If not already crowned, Sashi Moorman is certainly in the running for king of cool-climate Syrah. This appellation blend from Patterson and Casa Cassara vineyards begins with fresh lavender, crunchy black raspberry, white pepper and singed rosemary on the nose. The palate continues the message, showing char, tar, pepper, purple fruits, gritty tannins and bright acidity. Drink now through 2038.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Piedrasassi 2018 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This is an excellent bottling of Penfolds's single-vineyard Shiraz, from the vines on its historic home block, offering more character and rusticity than many of its more polished, muscly reds. The nose is plush but not jammy, the plum and dark cherry fruit flecked with chocolate, cigar box, fresh herbs and spices and a mineral nuance. Chalky tannins strike a balance between power and structure. A lucid wine with raw charm but also with the length and complexity expected of a premium bottling. Drink 2022–2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penfolds 2018 Magill Estate Shiraz (Adelaide)

Description: Notes of schist and iodine meld into sprays of violet and rose petal in this vibrant, perfumed Syrah. Matured for 15 to 28 months in large-format casks, it offers a rich core of raspberry-coulis and red-currant flavors struck by crisp acidity and very fine, mouthcoating tannins. The finish lingers on a subtle kiss of smoke and cedar. While approachable now, it should gain nuance through 2030 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Denuzière 2018 J. Denuzière  (Côte Rôtie)

Description: Notes of char, iron and tobacco leaf accent penetrating black-cherry and cassis flavors in this muscular expression of Côte-Rôtie. Produced from 100% whole-cluster Syrah and matured twelve months in 30% new French oak, it's a weighty, intensely structured red framed by firm, gripping tannins and a delicately earthen, meaty finish. While nervous in youth it should hit peak from 2023 and improve another decade still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2018  Côte Rôtie

Description: This is a solid expression of Langhorne Creek, a historic region in South Australia, made from the winery's best blocks of Shiraz by winemaker Rebecca Willson. There's lovely purity and layers of flavor: currants, wild mint, bay and tobacco leaf and five-spice powder. Polished, vanillin oak is present, too, but rides in the backseat. The mouthfeel is silky and fleshy, with fine, well-structured tannins holding together a powerful wine. Tangy fruit and savory, herbal notes linger on the finish. Drink 2022–2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Bremerton 2015 Old Adam Shiraz (Langhorne Creek)

Description: Pencil shavings, iron, crushed rock and lavender provide an earthy and savory opening to this bold, burly and impressive wine, bursting in black fruit. The oak is supportive and toasted, adding seasonings of white pepper, nutmeg and a touch of coffee, boosting an already heady experience of flavor and texture.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donelan 2016 Grande Syrah (Sonoma County)

Description: Like its sister wine, Omahu, this is a precise, tightly knit wine for the cellar that beautifully captures both the power and the elegance of Hawke's Bay Syrah. Like a hug in a glass, it offers comforting aromas of melted chocolate, baking spice, ground pepper, fresh brambly berries and a hint of something more mineral. The palate is broad but focused, and more approachable young than Omahu. Tannins are beautifully textured, talc-like and spicy, cradling the pristine fruit. Drink now–2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Smith and Sheth 2018 Cru Heretaunga Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

Description: The latest vintage of Homage is a strong one. Straight out of the gate it offers heady aromas of cherries, mint, baking and savory spices, black olives and violets. The oak is fairly prominent, too. In the mouth it's taut and linear, with fine, savory tannins and lovely lifted fruit and spice throughout. Should have a long and beautiful life ahead of it. Drink now–2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Trinity Hill 2018 Homage Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Notes of camphor and licorice lend sultry, spicy inflections to blueberry and cassis in this rare 100% Syrah from Gigondas. Fermented predominantly destemmed and matured 18 months in oak casks, it's a profoundly fruity, powerful wine but silky and lifted too. Delicious already, the wine should improve through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine des Bosquets 2018 Les Routes  (Gigondas)

Description: The cellar is the only place for this austere and tightly structured Syrah for the time being, but with a little patience, it should reward in spades. Aromas of pristine red berry fruit, savory herbs and spices, graphite and prominent oak are wound tightly in dusty, chiseled tannins. Depth, balance, length and poise—it's all here. An expertly structured wine hinting at decades of deliciousness to come. Drink 2023–2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Smith and Sheth 2018 Cru Omahu Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Te Mata's estate Syrah is once again a lucid, approachable beauty. This vintage is more layered than the previous one, unraveling flavors and textures. First bright cherry and plums, then graphite, savory herbs and floral aromas like herbs de Provence. In fact, there's a Southern French kitchen feel about this in general. The palate is linear and taut, with leathery tannins, crisp acidity and tart fruit. There's a savory edge to the finish. A serious yet highly drinkable Syrah, especially when paired with roast lamb.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Mata 2019 Estate Vineyards Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

Description: In collaboration with Yves Cuilleron, this is made in a Côte-Rôtie style with a touch of Viognier cofermented within. Lively in acidity and enduringly fresh, it offers varietal garrigue and brooding blackberry and cherry dappled in black and white pepper, the texture supple and impressive in length and breadth.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2017 Cuilleron Vivio Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)

Description: Syrah's sultry cassis and blackberry flavors are lifted by Viognier's airy floral perfume in this full-bodied, robust red. Etched by schist and a piercing vein of iodine, it's a deeply fruity but complex wine that wears its earthen, smoky subtleties with finesse. The finish lingers on a grip of fine, sandpapery tannins. At peak from 2022–2030, the wine will hold much longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Les Alexandrins 2018  Côte Rôtie

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted black plum, star anise, clove, charred beef and hints of tar show on the dynamic nose of this cool-climate Syrah bottling. The mouthfeel is lighter and airy, delivering freshly cracked peppercorn, lavender, dark berry and lightly gamy flavors of singed hair and flesh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Spear 2018 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Asphalt, tar and uncracked black pepper aromas make for a spicy, reductive nose on this bottling, which saw 66% whole cluster fermentation, yet there are also waves of riper black-raspberry jam and warm hints of toast. It's light in the glass, offering dried cranberry, white pepper and eucalyptus-leaf flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Spear 2018 Block 19 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This vintage of single-block, biodynamically grown Shiraz is more textbook than the cooler 2017. While it lacks the sexiness of '17, it still offers more restraint and elegance than many of its South Aussie counterparts. An aromatic lift of tangy blueberry, raspberry and plum fruit interlaces gentle baking spice, ground pepper and terra-cotta notes. There's muscle to the highly textural tannins (both chalky and granular), but it's woven into layers of flavor. A charming yet serious wine for drinking now until 2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yangarra 2018 King's Wood Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

Description: A whisper of tar lends an earthen, smoky undertone to sultry black-currant and plum flavors in this 100% Syrah. Matured 12 months in used-oak barrels, it is weighty and powerful, packed with black fruit and a sylph-like frame of acidity. Soft, silky tannins make it immediately enjoyable but it should improve well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Jolivet 2018 L'Instinct  (Saint-Joseph)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted boysenberry, charcoal, cracked pepper and freshly dug muddy hole aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's very taut in structure on the sip, where white pepper and thyme wade through richer tones of charred berry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Piedrasassi 2018 Rim Rock Vineyard Syrah (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Description: Sun-drenched blackberry and cassis flavors are accented by hints of vanilla and olive tapenade in this full-bodied, voluptuous Syrah. It's a richly extracted red matured for 12 to 16 months in a combination of new and one-year-old oak but maintains a fresh, mineral spine and lifting acidity throughout. It's ready now but should drink well through 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine des Remizières 2018  Saint-Joseph

Description: This well-respected winery is located in the cool climes of the Great Dividing Range, west of Melbourne. Langi is its top red, from rare, pre-phylloxera Shiraz clones planted in 1969. It offers a lovely lift of red cherry, violet, tobacco and spice with a spine of vanilla cola from the oak. The medium- to full-bodied palate follows through on the freshness factor with lifted acidity and fruit purity, wound in leathery, herbal tannins. Drink now–2031, at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Mount Langi Ghiran 2017 Langi Shiraz (Grampians)

Appellation: Arroyo Grande Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted boysenberry, charcoal, cracked pepper and freshly dug muddy hole aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's very taut in structure on the sip, where white pepper and thyme wade through richer tones of charred berry.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Piedrasassi 2018 Rim Rock Vineyard Syrah (Arroyo Grande Valley)

Description: Entirely varietal, this wine is fruity, spicy and full bodied, an impressive study in tar, earth, lavender and iron. Textured and densely packed, it is lengthy with rounded, supple tannin structure and shows the peppery earthiness of whole-cluster fermentation (38%). The vineyards include Steiner, Lawer and Kobler.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donelan 2016 Cuvée Christine Syrah (Sonoma County)

Description: Sourced from 50-year-old vines of co-planted Grenache (95%) and Viognier (5%), this piercing, peppery wine showcases concentrated flavors of redcurrant jelly and blackberry pastilles. Matured 18 months in oak barrels (15% new), it's a weighty, structured red anchored by zingy acidity and subtle strikes of crushed earth, smoke and iron. At peak from 2023–2030, the wine is likely to hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Jean-Luc Colombo 2018 La Divine  (Côte Rôtie)

Description: Earthy chestnut skin and schist juxtapose black currant and black-cherry menthol in this solidly built, pure-fruited Syrah. Full bodied yet lifted in acidity, it finishes on elongated tones of smoke and cedar. Just approaching peak now, the wine should improve through 2030 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cave de Tain 2017 Nobles Rives  (Hermitage)

Description: Give this plenty of time in a decanter. Once open, this is an expressive Syrah (with 3% Viognier) that's savory and meaty. It offers a nose full of cherries, plums, dried herbs and a charred beef character reminiscent of Northern Rhône. There's some dense, earthy oak notes here, too. The palate follows a similar flavor path. It's silky with a crunch to the acidity and a fine tannin structure. A finessed wine set for aging until 2028 or so.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Vidal 2018 Legacy Gimblett Gravels Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Notes of lime and crushed stones lend verve to this full-bodied varietal Marsanne. It's a blossomy, fresh-fruited wine packed with crisp, white-peach and grapefruit flavors along with a lingering smoky, herbal finish. At peak now–2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cave de Tain 2018 Nobles Rives  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: This is a very light spin on Syrah, yet works to translate the rugged character of Chalone. Aromas of rusty cherry, dried strawberry and sagebrush on the nose lead into a crisp palate loaded with red plum and white pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Seabold Cellars 2018 La Sarriette Rodnick Farm Syrah (Chalone)

Description: Sprays of cinnamon, clove and cedar accent plush black currant and blueberry in this varietal Syrah sourced from vines averaging 65 years in age. Matured 15 months in a combination of new (70%) and one-year old (30%) oak barrels, it's a rich, sultry wine shaded by crushed stones, smoke and licorice. Ripe, silky tannins make it ready to enjoy now but this structured wine should improve through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine des Remizières 2018 Cuvée Christophe  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Chapel Hill's back label includes a shout-out to the growers whose fruit made the cut for this vintage of their premium Shiraz—a nice and all-too-rare gesture. It's a hefty wine destined for the cellar, with bushels of plum, cherry and raspberry fruit leading on the nose, backed by mocha, savory spice and cigar box. Tannins are taut and powerful, with an oaky underbelly set for the long haul. Beneath the power lies a lovely purity of fruit. A solidly crafted wine that should unravel nicely over the years. Drink 2023–2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Chapel Hill 2018 The Vicar Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Those seeking wines of tremendous power and unctuous oak will enjoy this booming bottling, which was aged in 71% new barrels and begins with aromas of milk chocolate, cassis, maple butter and purple flowers. It's thick and lush on the palate, where caramelized black-fruit, creamy cappuccino and bold baking-spice flavors go big.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Law 2017 Intrepid Syrah (Adelaida District)

Description: Blackberry and elderberry notes are concentrated but restrained in this classically earthen, salt-edged Syrah. Accented by a whiff of violet and fur, it's a shyer expression of Hermitage than is typical in these increasingly hot, sun-drenched vintages, but one that would welcome a few more years to let its subtleties develop. It's best to wait till 2023. The wine should improve through at least 2030 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vidal-Fleury 2017  Hermitage

Description: Shards of iron and black pepper juxtapose powerfully ripe black-plum and mulberry flavors in this inky Syrah. It's a deeply extracted expression of Saint-Joseph but anchored neatly by bristling acidity and fine, supple tannins. At peak now–2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Yannick Alléno & Michel Chapoutier 2018 Croix de Chabot  (Saint-Joseph)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Those seeking wines of tremendous power and unctuous oak will enjoy this booming bottling, which was aged in 71% new barrels and begins with aromas of milk chocolate, cassis, maple butter and purple flowers. It's thick and lush on the palate, where caramelized black-fruit, creamy cappuccino and bold baking-spice flavors go big.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Law 2017 Intrepid Syrah (Adelaida District)

Description: Not much of this crowd-pleasing wine was made, but what exists is a lively and fresh expression that's bold in peppery spice and garrigue. A leathery backbone of cola and nutmeg contribute nuanced richness to the blackberry and cherry fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2017 Drouthy Neebors Syrah (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: From Master Sommelier and Master of Wine Doug Frost, the aromas of this wine are restrained out of the gate, but reveal notes of raspberry, cranberry, thistle, herb, orange peel and violet that blossom over time. It's a reserved styling, with flavors that stick around on the finish. The emphasis is on purity, restraint and a vibrant sense of acidity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Echolands 2018 Les Collines Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This concentrated, focused and intense wine is laser-focused on black-fruit flavors that go deep and broad on the palate and linger nicely on the finish. A very deep color leads to scents of black pepper, blueberries and mocha, while ripe, saturated blackberry and blueberry take over the flavors, wrapped in fine-grained tannins. Best through 2027.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Casque 2018 Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy in strawberry, blueberry and cranberry flavors, this red is lifted and enduringly fresh. Bright acidity boosts both the fruit and meatiness that accompanies the wine—a mix of game, mushroom and black pepper.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2017 Samantha's Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Intriguing aromas of turned earth and tobacco lead to engaging black-fruit, wood-char and singed herb flavors in this complex, handsomely layered and full-bodied wine. This High Ground bottling was blended from Karen Meyer's best barrels. It is fascinating to drink now but best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Meyer Family Cellars 2017 High Ground Syrah (Yorkville Highlands)

Description: Where the cool 2017 brought increased elegance to Hickinbotham's muscular reds, this vintage returns to the powerful expression of warmer years. A big wine it may be, with a nose of strawberry and cherry preserves, mint, medicinal herbs and a toasty, vanillin underbelly, but it's also precise and site expressive. Tannins are fine yet powerful, and the oak is present, but this is a baby, worthy of many years in the cellar. Drink 2023–2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hickinbotham 2018 Brooks Road Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart black-plum and baking-spice aromas are quickly consumed by funkier, earthier elements of tar, crushed rocks and game on the nose of this bottling. The snappy dark-fruit flavors pair expertly with savory bay leaf, sage and cracked pepper flavors, leading into a finish that's full of pepper-crusted teriyaki beef elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lester 2017 Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Bottle age has done this wine well—it's in a great drinking spot at the moment. The nose is fruity and appealing: raspberry, blueberry and plum take the lead, backed by notes of vanilla bean, five-spice powder and bay leaf. There's a long line of textural tannins on the medium-weight palate. The crunchy fruit is laced with spice. A food-friendly bottling for drinking now until around 2026.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Levantine Hill 2015 Melissa'sPaddock Syrah (Yarra Valley)

Description: This stony, deeply mineral Syrah balances crisp cassis and black-cherry flavors against a deeply earthen core. It's opulent in texture but stately, uplifted by tangs of salt, iron and granite. The finish is framed by soft, easing tannins making it approachable young but it should drink at peak through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Denuzière 2018 J. Denuzière  (Saint-Joseph)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense aromas of fudge, smoked beef shanks and berry and plum compote show on the hefty nose of this bottling, which includes 9% Grenache. It's thick on the palate, where espresso-cream, cocoa and charred meat flavors sit atop dark-cassis notes.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Asuncion Ridge 2017 Nefarious Syrah (Paso Robles)

Description: Inflections of vanilla bean, char and sweet-spice are prominent but meld into succulent black-currant and mulberry flavors in this silky, medium-bodied Syrah. Matured 22 months in new oak, it's a lavish but elegantly structured wine marked by pert acidity and a swathe of fresh green herbs framing the finish. Ready now the wine should drink well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Louis Chèze 2017 Anges  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Fresh sprays of granite and salt accent bristling redcurrants and cherries in this fresh, mouthdrenching Syrah. Full bodied yet invigorating on the midpalate, it's a pure-fruited but deeply mineral wine. Fine, supple tannins make it ready to drink now but the wine should stay at peak through 2028.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2018  Crozes-Hermitage

Description: Black raspberries and flecks of violet candy perfume this feather-edged Syrah. It's pillowy soft in mouthfeel but accented by streaks of cassis acidity and a subtly smoky, granite finish. Approachable in youth, the wine will improve through 2028 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château de Saint-Cosme 2018  Saint-Joseph

Description: This elegant, softly spoken Clare Valley Shiraz opens with gentle floral and red berry notes, underscored by graphite, mineral and spice nuances. The palate is medium in weight and ultrafresh. It lacks some fruit weight to soften all that acidity, but overall is bright, with length and focus. Drink now–2027.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Adelina 2018 Shiraz (Clare Valley)

Description: Sun-kissed and fruity, this plummy Syrah offers ripe blueberry and black-plum flavors held upright by a striking acidic spine. It's full bodied and opulent yet vivacious and spry. Finishing long on fine, silky tannins, crushed stone and peppery spice, it's best enjoyed now through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Combier 2018  Crozes-Hermitage

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this producer's trademark style, this wine is released young, with no new oak contact. Flower, tobacco, dried herb and dark cherry aromas are followed by lighter-styled flavors that still bring intensity. Purity is the purpose. Pair it with grilled lamb chops.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Savage Grace 2019 Red Willow Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Bright in black fruit, with a touch of varietal game, grilled mushroom and black pepper, this balanced, complex red also offers a hint of lavender. Native fermentation and neutral oak allow the fruit, spice and earthiness to speak around beautifully lifted acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2017 Greywacke Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Leathery and earthy on the palate, this wine is velvety in texture, with nuanced ripeness and underlying richness that is complemented by fresh acidity. Lavender, white pepper and grippy strawberry combine effortlessly to bring balance and complexity to the fore.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2017 Atoosa's Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tightly wound aromas of dark plum and berry meet with hints of seared beef and uncracked peppercorns on the nose of this bottling, which is quite mellow despite its alcohol content. Crisp black-raspberry flavors pop on the sip, leading into cocoa spice (that is nearly fudge), with tight tannins as the wrapping.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: MCV 2018 Syrah (Paso Robles)

Description: Sun-scorched underbrush and iron juxtapose blackberry and plum in this fleshy, full-bodied Syrah. It's a fresh-fruited, juicy wine elevated by an upright acidic spine and lingering notes of granite and iodine. Ready to drink now, the wine should hold well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ravoire et Fils 2018 Olivier Ravoire  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Generous aromas of blistered boysenberries and violets are joyous and juicy while complex and fresh on the nose of this bottling. It's boisterous on the palate with superzesty flavors of açaí and more violet.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Four Lanterns 2017 Reserva Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: This is a big, broody and fairly classic Hawke's Bay Syrah set for the long haul. There's a deep well of comforting aromas: dense black fruits, savory herbs, winter warming spices and a slightly stony, sanguine, mineral nuance amid the oak influence. The door to the palate is more tightly shut. Spicy, granular tannins are powerful and a little astringent. Acidity is lifted. It needs time to knit together with the fruit. However, the cool(ish) climate elegance peeks through the cracks, hinting at a promising future. Drink now with protein until 2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Stonecroft 2018 Reserve Gimblett Gravels Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

Description: This is a chiseled, earthy wine that showcases the relative cool climate of Yarra Valley with the power of Aussie Shiraz. It opens with some mushroomy funk that mingles with raspberry, cherry, vanilla cola and cedary spice. Granular with a tug of savory tannins, the palate is uniquely textured. Acidity is a little sharp, making the fruit feel a touch sour, but there's a lovely spiciness and minerality, too. Drink now–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Levantine Hill 2016 Syrah (Yarra Valley)

Description: This full-bodied Syrah juxtaposes powerful black-fruited ripeness with cutting cassis and sour-cherry acidity. It's a concentrated, meaty expression of Saint-Joseph, with a finish that lingers on notes of iron and graphite. Soft tannins make it welcoming already but it's structured enough to drink at peak through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Les Alexandrins 2018  Saint-Joseph

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hints of tar meet with charred purple fruit and delicate purple flowers on the nose of this bottling from a cooler- climate site near Pismo Beach. The palate blooms with thyme, crushed peppercorn and mace spice, layered over the blackberry and cherry-compote flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ragtag 2017 Spanish Springs Vineyard Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dusty Nabor manages to keep prices stunningly low on this line of wines. This cool-climate expression shows peppercorn, dewy rosemary, lilac, bay leaf and fresh elderberry on the nose. The palate pairs savory charred lamb with berry compote, dusted in cracked pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dusty Nabor 2018 NSO Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, wood spice and dark fruit aromas are followed by smooth, sultry flavors. Fruit and barrel play equal parts in the show, with the vintage's bright acidity keeping them both in vivid focus.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pursued by Bear 2017 Baby Bear Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Whispers of eucalyptus and charred clove lend spice to black-currant and cherry flavors in this 100% Syrah sourced from vines averaging 45 years in age. Matured 15 months in a combination of new and used oak, it's full bodied and deeply concentrated but maintains freshness and vitality. Delicious now the wine should hold well through 2029.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine des Remizières 2019  Crozes-Hermitage

Description: This is one of a limited production range of single-variety wines. Produced from Syrah, the wine is richly perfumed and has an earthy edge that is typical of the grape when young. This wine therefore needs further aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta da Romaneira 2018 Syrah (Duriense)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A lovely and lighthearted red wine, this is earthy and barnyardy, soft and supple on the palate in bright and lengthy layers of delicate texture. Lavender, black and white pepper and wild game combine for a varietal experience of finesse and delight.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2017 Timbervine Ranch Syrah (Russian River Valley)

Description: Whispers of coffee beans and roasted cacao lend subtle smokiness to zesty redcurrant and blackberry flavors in this wine. Refreshingly slim on the palate, it's a crisply concentrated Syrah edged by fine-grained, sandpaper tannins and a crush of granite on the finish. Best now–2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Anthony Paret 2017 Les Larmes du Père  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Te Mata's premium Shiraz is a powerful and chiseled wine in need of more time in the bottle. Currently it shows ripe cherry fruit, peppery spice and quite a bit of high gloss oak influence. The palate is cinched in muscular tannins and lifted by quite a bit of acidity. At the moment the two are not in harmony, but it likely needs several more years before it all knits together. Drink 2023–2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Mata 2018 Bullnose Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

Description: Hints of black olive and char lend savory undertones to brisk black currant and mulberry in this wine. Delicately spiced and supple in mouthfeel, it's a fruity but structured Syrah accented by zesty red-cherry acidity and fine, penetrating tannins. The finish lingers on notes of coffee bean and dried bramble.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cave de Tain 2018 Grand Classique  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Bright, penetrating black cherry and raspberry flavors are shaded by hints of ash and smoke in this sun-drenched but elegant Syrah. Full bodied and fleshy on the palate, it's an immediately enjoyable red layered with fine, satiny tannins. At peak now–2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Clairmont 2018 Domaine de Saint-Clément Horizon  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Sierra Pelona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Black-plum-sauce, spice-cake and dried mushroom aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a rugged corner of Southern California. Rich black-currant and fruitcake flavors hint at the age on the palate, but the coffee, cinnamon and Christmas spice flavors keep it in a good place.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Agua Dulce 2015 Reserve Syrah (Sierra Pelona Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of dark fruit, spice and dried herbs. Rich, full-bodied flavors follow, with bunched up tannins providing support. It's a no-holds-barred offering of the variety. Give it some time in the decanter.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: L'Ecole No. 41 2018 Estate Grown Seven Hills Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Savory, tarry aromas of grilled meat and white pepper meet with richer black-plum and lavender aromas on the nose of this bottling. There is a hearty boysenberry streak to the palate, as well as pepper and oak flavors, with a straight line if acidity pushing into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Dusty Nabor 2018 Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

Description: Bold notes of vanilla and toasted cashew introduce this lusciously textured, dry white. A blend of Marsanne (60%) and Roussanne (40%) matured eight to ten months in new French oak, it balances white-peach and tangerine flavors against layers of struck flint, smoke and stone. It's an abundant, hedonistic wine that's delicious young but concentrated and complex enough to improve well through 2030 and hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Louis Chèze 2018 Ro-Rée  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Delicate swathes of eucalyptus and bramble accent pristine blackberry and plum in this juicy, immediately inviting Syrah. Full bodied and freshly concentrated, it's a vibrant red edged by an elegant granitic spine. Fine, delicately lingering tannins add to its easy appeal. Best now–2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pierre le Grand 2018  Crozes-Hermitage

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The college students continue to impress on these bottlings. This bottling begins with thyme, lavender, white pepper and açaí aromas on the nose. The palate picks up dust and leather, giving earthy depth to the boysenberry and black-plum flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Allan Hancock 2018 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from four appellations across the state. The aromas boast notes of coffee, char, dark fruit, smoke and spice. The dark fruit and barrel flavors are velvety in feel, showing intensity but still remaining light on their feet, particularly given the warmth of the vintage.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2015 Ethos Reserve Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big, bold wine packs plenty of ripe and rich blackberry and black-cherry flavors in fine-grained tannins, for a mouthfilling and delicious palate sensation. It offers good concentration, a nicely polished texture and tasty, chocolaty accents.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mount Saint Joseph Wines 2017 Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Garrigue and barnyards-like earthiness meet quenching red fruit in this lively, light-bodied red from a cool-climate site. Citrus peel and white pepper add to the balanced mix.                      Virginie Boone
Name: MacLaren 2017 Bonnie Glen Syrah (Bennett Valley)

Description: This is a ripe, dense Syrah with notes of plush berry fruit, chocolaty oak, mint and earthy spice. It lacks much of the herbal, mineral nuances of Hawke's Bay Syrah. The palate is full-figured, plush and wrapped in drying, slightly chewy tannins. A rich wine that needs time in the bottle. Drink 2022–2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Elephant Hill 2018 Stone Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black currant, tar, dark purple flowers and a hint of brown sugar show on the nose of this bottling, which retains freshness six years after harvest. There is a rich texture to the palate, where coffee and cocoa flavors provide a lush pairing to the tart black-plum elements. The tannins coat the tongue through the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hunt Cellars 2014 Hilltop Serenade Grand Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black currant, tar, dark purple flowers and a hint of brown sugar show on the nose of this bottling, which retains freshness six years after harvest. There is a rich texture to the palate, where coffee and cocoa flavors provide a lush pairing to the tart black-plum elements. The tannins coat the tongue through the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hunt Cellars 2014 Hilltop Serenade Grand Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Pristine blackberry and plum flavors are etched by graphite in this juicy, thirst-quenching Syrah. While full bodied and intensely ripe, it's a crisply concentrated, mineral sip that finishes on fine, softly edged tannins. Best enjoyed now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Gassier 2018 Fleur de Syrah Syrah (Costières de Nîmes)

Description: From the small, high-quality region of Beechworth in Victoria, this initially feels quite oak-driven, with sweet, polished barrel aromas dominating. With time in a glass, though, the blueberry fruit, floral and spice notes make their way to the fore. The palate shows more freshness and focus, with fruit purity and a lovely violet and baking spice note flowing to the finish. There's currently a fair lick of alcohol and oak here, but it's a decent bet this could cellar nicely until around 2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Fighting Gully Road 2017 Reserve Syrah (Beechworth)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied wine offers rich dried-fruit flavors and a broad, moderately tannic texture. Dried fig, plum and blueberry fill it to the brim.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2017 Syrah (Amador County)

Appellation: Côtes du Rhône, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Although a Côtes du Rhône labeling most often suggests a southern Grenache blend, this varietal Syrah from the Northern Rhône offers crisp, fresh-fruited blackberry and cassis flavors accented by hints of granite and bramble. Delicate in tannins and plush on the palate, it's an immediately enjoyable red at peak now through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Anthony Paret 2017 Valvigneyre Syrah (Côtes du Rhône)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from Ranch at the End of the Road. The first impression aromatically is of oak (18 months in new American), with notes of vanilla, nougat and freshly hewn wood. The palate almost has the fruit intensity to stand up to it, but ultimately the wood wins out. Coffee notes linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Liberty Lake 2018 Reserve Syrah (Red Mountain)

Description: Like Te Awanga's Mister Syrah, this is an open and aromatic bottling that veers away from the classic style. It doesn't, however, show nearly the charm or harmony of its sister wine. Cranberry and cherry notes lead on the nose, tailed by black olive, chocolate and earthy, savory herbs and spices. Acidity is elevated and angular. Tannins get a bit lost in their wake, but they're present, chalky textured and drying, amid soft fruit and spice.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Te Awanga 2016 Quarter Acre Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasing aromas of blue fruit, spice and fresh herbs lead to center focused fruit and barrel flavors that are light along the edges, broadening slightly over time. It shows some warmth on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tenet 2017 The Pundit Syrah (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are a bit reductive out of the gate. Beyond that are notes of dark fruit, purple fruit and spice. Full-bodied, rich flavors follow. It doesn't all come together yet.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tenet 2017 The Pundit Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This project from Chateau Ste. Michelle and France's Philippe Cambie and Michel Gassier has previously focused on Columbia Valley offerings, but now explores subappellation wines as well. The aromas offer notes of mulberry and smoke with whiffs of medicine. The flavors are center focused and seem bunched up, broadening over time. Light medicinal notes linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Tenet 2017 The Pundit Syrah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The variety is on full display, with this wine's notes of blue-purple fruit and whiffs of smoked meat. Soft fruit flavors follow, thinning out a little toward the middle but otherwise showing impressive balance. It goes down easy.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2018 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is classic South Aussie Shiraz, with a winter warming nose of plush plums, eucalyptus and peppery spice, wrapped in chocolatey oak. The palate is equally round, plush and oak-influenced. There's plenty of ripe fruit and spice amid a woolly texture and tannins that finish with some astringency.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Kellermeister 2016 The Pious Pioneer Dry Grown Shiraz (Barossa)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Charred beef, dried blackberry, leather and a touch of smashed asphalt show on the nose of this bottling. Deep and dark flavors of slightly sour black plum meet with dried herb and tar on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Ryder Estate 2019 Syrah (Central Coast)

Appellation: Petaluma Gap-Marin County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This light-bodied but tightly wound wine grips flavors of salt, pepper, charred beef and blueberry with very firm tannins that will need time to mellow, or a very rich dish with which to pair. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendric 2018 Proprietor Grown Syrah (Petaluma Gap-Marin County)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This superripe, jammy-tasting wine is full bodied, packed with black-fruit flavors and very rich in texture. A hint of sweetness accompanies the blackberry, blueberry and black-cherry flavors that rest on relatively light tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2016 Broken Leg Vineyard Syrah (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas don't seem settled, with notes of nori, smoke and blue fruit. Quite smoky flavors follow, with a strong wash of char on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Dusted Valley 2018 Stained Tooth Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of dried herbs, vanilla, medicine and cherry gummy bear. Plush medicinal flavors follow. The medicinal influence is strong.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Adrice 2017 Bare Knuckle Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This gutsy, concentrated wine blends bold wood char with balsamic aromas and offers mature, perfumed flavors on a full body braced by firm tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mathew Gibson 2015 Estate Syrah (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The balsamic-like tang is sharp on the nose of this bottling, full of tart black-plum and violet aromas. The palate is also sharp with acetic notes, which distract from the ripe purple fruits.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jalama 2018 La Presa Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Unusual aromas of spearmint, medicine, violet and tire rubber lead to lighter-styled fruit leather flavors that finish short. The tannins feel quite grainy.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Hogue 2015 Genesis Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is an epic bottling, overloaded with lush layers of umami and expertly captured fruit. Aromas of baked black plum, currant, cappuccino, dark chocolate and black pepper play on the nose. Framed by firm yet forgiving tannins, the palate combines dry elderberry and prune flavors with charred lamb and beef, asphalt and cracked pepper. This is powerfully elegant, with 3% Viognier and 2% Grenache.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Clos Solène 2018 Hommage a Nos Pairs Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: So intensely dark that it's almost opaque in the glass, this bottling from the famed Z and X blocks of Bien Nacido Vineyard is extremely polished on the seductive nose, where black currant, singed violet, charred lamb and subtle waves of earth and herb converge. Suave, silky tannins frame the sip, where the dark-berry and violet flavors meet with singed game and pepper dust.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Clos Solène 2018 Cuvée Jean Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This showcase of the historic Paderewski property, which includes 6% Mourvèdre and 2% Viognier, begins with expertly captured aromas of black current, dark berry, mocha, cappuccino cream and hot vanilla cake. Elegant layers of violet, lilac and acai mesh into roasted cocoa on the palate, where polished tannins keep the waves of flavor and texture coming.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Epoch 2017 Authenticity Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: 2017 was a relatively cool vintage in McLaren Vale and on Yangarra's Shiraz in particular, it makes for more elegance and refreshment. Lucid and expressive, this opens with a melange of aromas: cherries and currents, sweet and savory spices, chocolate, floral and mineral base notes. The palate follows suit just as you'd expect with a lovely juxtaposition between elegance and crunchy red berries tempered by taut, fine, highly textural tannins. A spiciness lingers. Drink now with rustic, meaty autumn and winter dishes or cellar until 2035 at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yangarra 2017 Ironheart Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Piquant, tart and snappy aromas of underripe berries and plums meet with lavender and crumpled dahlia on the nose of this bottling. The white-pepper, wild-thyme and bay leaf flavors are focused and pure on the palate, where black-plum and more lavender tones make for a fresh, lightly bodied and zesty expression.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Piedrasassi 2018 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a booming, powerful bottling, starting with lush and hearty aromas of black fruit, roasted game and grilled fig. The palate is dense and viscous, with dark boysenberry and more roasted fig flavors as well as hints of violet and lavender. But, it's the savory side of black pepper and rich grilled meat that carry the weight.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Justin 2016 Focus Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: From the historic Paderewski Vineyard, this complex bottling begins with aromas of crumpled lavender, charred lamb, tangy elderberry jam and savory white pepper, surrounding a rich black-currant streak at the core. The charred meat and deep, dark fruit character rolls through the palate, where elegant spices are sure to grow more intriguing with time. Drink now through 2032.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Epoch 2017 Block B Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A blend of the 470, 174 and Estrella clones, this is an excellent show of cool-climate Syrah, beginning with the tart black-plum, lavender, charred and raw meat and cracked pepper aromas on the nose. Piquant purple flower and tart plum flavors pop on the palate, where white pepper and game provide the savory touchstones.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Paradise Springs 2018 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lavish aromas of cassis, baked berry, caramel, vanilla cream and cracked pepper make for a very heady, impressive nose on this bottling. Smooth tannins start the sip before standing up to be more firm, as rich, thick flavors of currant and baking spice get washed by acid into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Écluse 2018 Syrah (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brooding aromas of dark plum, roasted fig, asphalt and black pepper are deep, rich and savory on the nose of this bottling. Tightly woven tannins frame the generous black-currant, cracked pepper, espresso and violet flavors of the acid-boosted sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2015 McGinley Vineyard Syrah (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Brooding aromas of dark plum, roasted fig, asphalt and black pepper are deep, rich and savory on the nose of this bottling. Tightly woven tannins frame the generous black-currant, cracked pepper, espresso and violet flavors of the acid-boosted sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2015 McGinley Vineyard Syrah (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: This is a spicy, lusciously fruity wine. Rich blackberry flavors are sustained by the tannins and the succulent acidity and texture. Aged for 18 months in wood, the wine was selected from what the producer considered a fine harvest. Drink this generous wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Quinta do Pinto 2017 Syrah Syrah (Lisboa)

Description: This bottling offers notes of plum, blackberry, dark chocolate, mint, cedar and tobacco, with a distinctive underbelly of green peppercorn spice. The palate is full-bodied but not heavy, with great depth of flavor, muscular tannins and silky fruit. It offers plenty of precision and charm. Drink now–2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: John Duval Wines 2017 Eligo Shiraz (Barossa)

Description: All the hallmarks of Barossa Shiraz are here without much fuss. A heady, fruity nose of cherry and currant ride a wave of baking spice, mocha, furniture polish and earthy, mineral tones. The tannins are powerful but fine and nicely textured. There's also enough polish here for a bit of cellaring. Drink now–2025.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Seppeltsfield 2018 Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a flat-out beautiful expression of valley Syrah. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of blueberry, plum and herb. The palate brings weight and volume but never gets bogged down, showing plenty of deftness and dexterity. The balance throughout is captivating as is the exceptionally lengthy, flavorful finish, kicking it up a notch. Gorgeous stuff. It wins on grace, balance and sneaky intensity rather than brawn.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Valdemar 2018 Blue Mountain Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Almost all of the fruit for this wine comes from the LeFore Vineyard. Aromas of earth, red plum, orange rind, huckleberry and spice lead to full-feeling, palate-coating flavors. It shows a lot of layering, detail, depth, finesse and freshness. The balance is impeccable.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Valdemar 2018 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Almost all of the fruit for this wine comes from the LeFore Vineyard. Aromas of earth, red plum, orange rind, huckleberry and spice lead to full-feeling, palate-coating flavors. It shows a lot of layering, detail, depth, finesse and freshness. The balance is impeccable.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Valdemar 2018 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Powerful flavors of charcoal, black pepper, wood smoke and coffee bean crowd around a core of jazzy, ripe and meaty black-fruit flavors for a great display of the complexity that Syrah can offer. Full body and moderate tannins are balanced by fresh acidity, making it a good candidate for mid-term aging. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2017 Reserve Syrah (El Dorado)

Description: Full bodied and firmly structured with tannins, this wine from an under-the-radar producer shows abundant wild, roasted, gamy and singed-herb flavors. It's deeply savory, smoky and yet offers a great foundation of blueberry and blackberry underneath. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Fasi Estate 2019 Private Reserve Estate Grown Syrah (Madera)

Description: This is a rich Shiraz from Coonawarra's terra rossa soils. Heady notes of plums, currants, baking spice, mint and licorice have an earthy, savory underbelly as well as a polish of toasty oak. Tannins are powerful but finely structured, pinning the fruit into place. A big, steak-friendly wine from a solid vintage with high gloss appeal. Drink now–2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penfolds 2018 Bin 128 Shiraz (Coonawarra)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This splendid reserve encapsulates the many exciting changes at this pioneering winery. Though the founder is long gone, the name remains, and now stands for biodynamic, soil-sensitive farming and innovative, cutting edge winemaking. Deep layers of boysenberry and blackberry fruit, a lovely touch of whipped cream and orange marmalade, and lingering streaks of clove and espresso are all in the mix in this focused, balanced, delicious wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Troon 2018 Whole Cluster Fermented Syrah (Applegate Valley)

Description: The average age of the vines for this premium Shiraz is 1936, but some date back to 1854. From French and American staves coopered on site, "Octavius" offers an evocative and multifaceted nose with everything from currants, licorice and mocha to cedar, bay leaf and cloves. There's a lovely woodsy, wintery vibe, and a touch of bottle age, too that softens the ripe fruit but highlights the oak. The palate is powerful and lean at the moment, with elevated acidity and taut, slightly woody tannins. There's a nice tang to the fruit. It's hard to predict how this will age but the hope is it's got another decade left in it at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2016 The Octavius Old Vine Shiraz (Barossa)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Rocks District wines are sometimes known for their brawn and outrageousness. This example shows the area is plenty capable of making wines focused on grace and finesse, too. The aromas are brooding, with notes of moist earth, blue fruits, plum and orange rind. The palate is rich in flavor and silky soft in feel, loaded with blue fruit flavors. The balance is exquisite and the length impressive. It's a very pretty, classy offering from the area but with no shortage of hedonism.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Valdemar 2018 Stoney Vine Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cocoa dust, hints of caramel and lush black cherry meet with hints of tar and asphalt on the nose of this bottling, which includes 3% Grenache. Soft, polished tannins frame the smoky cassis and black-plum core of the sip, with more savory notes of roasted fig on the fringes.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Copia 2018 The Source Syrah (Central Coast)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Classic varietal flavors come with the extra intensity of biodynamic farming practices. The southern Oregon sunshine gives Syrah a real boost throughout the region. It's bursting with boysenberry jam, brightened with citrusy acidity, and the flavors penetrate deeply down and through a lingering, clean finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Troon 2018 Kubli Bench Syrah (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is light in color for the variety and vintage. The aromas bring notes of peat, dried stem and moist soil. The elegant, textured smoked meat flavors meanwhile are all about grace and precision. A lingering finish follows. As always with this producer, it's a wine intended to be enjoyed with food. Pair it with grilled lamb chops.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gramercy 2017 John Lewis Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Cowhorn's reserves are given extra bottle age before release—a good policy with wines such as this dark, earthy and aromatic Syrah. Tart, chewy boysenberry and marionberry fruit is in play, along with chewy tannins and a broad streak of vanilla. This would best be tucked away another few years or aggressively decanted prior to drinking.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cowhorn 2016 Reserve Syrah (Applegate Valley)

Description: Despite the relatively cool climes of the Eden Valley and the lift of red fruit they provide, this is a big, rich wine with quite a lot of oak influence. Strawberry and cherry fruit is ensconced in mint chocolatey barrel characters. The palate is equally oak-driven, particularly on the finish. But there's a silkiness and freshness to the fruit, and tannins are textural and well-structured. This is destined for the cellar and should age nicely. Drink 2022–2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Powell & Son 2017 Loechel Shiraz (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Syrah is cofermented with 4% Viognier, and its aromas are bright, with notes of fresh orange zest, black olive, medicine, smoked meat and firepit. Soft, plush, velvety flavors follow. Orange rind notes linger on the finish. It has a juicy feel that ups the interest. The Viognier plays a prominent role at present.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2018 The Funk Estate Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Toasty aromas of caramelized black plums and blackberry jam meet with a wet soil minerality on the nose of this bottling. It's full flavored on the palate, where espresso-bean, grilled berry and charred plum elements are wrapped in heavy woodsmoke.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClain Cellars 2018 Sofia's Star Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked black-currant, woodsmoke, raspberry jam and smoked beef aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There's a tarragon and fennel combination on the palate that gives depth to the black-plum, dried berry and light cocoa flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Montemar 2015 Watch Hill Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Koonunga Hill, with its rich clay soil, is an old vine site often associated with Penfolds, who use the name for a whole range of their wines across multiple districts. This wine is entirely from the old vines. It's a high octane bottling, at 15% alcohol, but is a great example of the site. The nose is a heady combo of plums, blueberries, polished oak, baking spice and chocolate. There's a sleek sheen to the tannins and a lovely acidity that keeps the fruit fresh. Oak is very present here, too. Drink now–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Powell & Son 2017 Schulz Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This very dark bottling begins with powerful aromas of baked black currant, rich cocoa sauce and Dr Pepper-like spices on the nose. The palate is deep in purple fruits and flowers, with earthy stone, cappuccino and charred meat flavors also popping up.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: San Simeon 2019 Syrah (Paso Robles)

Description: One of Torbreck's most affordable reds, this is a rich, chocolaty winter warmer with plenty to like. Aromas of cranberry, plum, beetroot, cocoa and savory herbs and spices lead into a powerful, mouthcoating palate. Tannins are dusty and chewy, lightened by a lift of acidity and juicy fruit. There's a lick of oak showing here—more so than on the previous vintage. A plate of protein is recommended.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Torbreck 2018 Woodcutter's Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Varietally true, this proffers up the classic blue and purple fruits and earthy tannins, along with plenty of astringent herbal accents. Hints of umami, including dried seaweed, can be sniffed and tasted along with prettier plummy fruit. It finishes with ample, rather sticky tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cowhorn 2016 Sentience Syrah (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a classic expression of Rocks District fruit, with notes of green olive tapenade, chopped parsley, flower, orange rind, soot and, of course, a whiff of funk. Broad, expansive medicine and olive flavors follow, showing intensity and depth.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2018 The Stones Speak Estate Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas immediately place this wine in the Rocks District, with notes of moist earth, black pepper, peat and firepit, along with orange rind. Soft, plush fruit and savory flavors follow, bringing restraint and sophistication alongside a lightly creamy feel.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maison Bleue 2018 Frontière Funk Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of berry, gummy and cherry along with whiffs of smoke are followed by fruit flavors that bring purity. The balance is lovely.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maison Bleue 2018 Gravière Stone Valley Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a Rocks District vineyard known for its quality but never the area's signature funk, this producer's fruit-forward style is on display. Fresh berry, orange rind, flower and gummy bear aromas lead to elegant, pure fruit flavors. It's a vivid display of this area and vineyard.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Maison Bleue 2018 Voyageur LeFore Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
