Description: This robust and mouthcoating wine offers generous black fruits, hints of white and black pepper and a firm but rich texture. It flirts with a gamy, earthy character for added complexity that's rare in a wine this affordable.                      Jim Gordon
Name: One Leaf 2018 Shiraz (California)

Description: This is a rich, old school Barossa Shiraz. Plump fruit in the form of currents and blueberries are backed by notes of olive brine, earthy spice, charred veg and a furniture polish-and-vanilla-oak character. The palate is dense but not overtly syrupy or muscular. There's quite a bit of high gloss oak showing here but plenty of fruit and spice, too. This is well-groomed but wouldn't it be nice if a few freckles showed through all the makeup?                      Christina Pickard
Name: Powell & Son 2017 Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are reserved, with notes of green olive, cigar box, medicine and firepit. Sleek plum and savory flavors follow. It's pleasing, but all seems quite pulled back.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2018 Reserve Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Well balanced and elegant, this medium-bodied wine blends tasty but not showy cherry, black-and blackberry flavors on light tannins. It's easy to sip and appreciate and will be equally easy to pair with food.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Skinner 2018 Syrah (El Dorado)

Description: Blackberry-jam, muddled prune and fruitcake aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a high-elevation vineyard east of Salinas. Savory and rich flavors of roasted fig and plum meet with fudge and nutmeg on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2017 Solo Concert Coastview Vineyard Syrah (Monterey)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Firepit and Kalamata olive aromas are followed by pillowy soft smoke and medicine flavors. It brings plenty of goodness, but the medicinal notes distract.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2017 Lewis Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is a ripe Cab that opens with notes of currant, plum, tobacco and eucalyptus leaf, with a savory backbone. The palate is muscular, with fine, savory tannins and lingering fruit flavors. This lacks the depth and finesse of Tanunda's more premium wines but is a solid drop nonetheless.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Château Tanunda 2018 Grand Barossa Shiraz (Barossa)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted coffee, black-plum-extract and fig aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 9% Viognier. The palate is medium to lighter bodied, with tangy acidity and taut tannins revealing wild plum, dried berry and clay flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cooper-Garrod 2015 Test Pilot F-104 Starfighter Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of ember, funk, plum and coffee. With fruit coming from Watermill, Funk, Lewis and Anna Marie vineyards, the palate is more elegantly styled but still flavorful. It's a very pulled back, pretty expression of the variety.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Saviah 2018 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This Syrah has aromas of dark-skinned fruit, cedar and vanilla. The firm palate presents black-currant jam, licorice and mocha alongside polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa di Terra 2018 Poggio Querciolo Syrah (Toscana)

Description: Sourced from the Deux Vert Vineyard, this includes 10% Viognier, presumably cofermented. It's a delicate but deeply penetrating style, atypical for most Oregon Syrahs. Light, tart red fruits, citrus and a hint of leather push down and through, maintaining a fine balance in an evocative, herbal finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Day 2017 A Peridot Afternoon Syrah (Yamhill-Carlton)

Description: Penfolds's oldest bin label is an old school, American oak-laden wine. The nose hides the barrel influence somewhat with layers of mint, licorice, mocha and baking spice aromas propping up plump plum and dark cherry fruit. The palate, however, is highly oak-driven. The plush fruit sits heavily but offers some tangy refreshment amid a soft line of spicy tannins. Drink now–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penfolds 2018 Bin 28 Kalimna Shiraz (South Australia)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh black-currant and black-plum-extract aromas show on the nose of this bottling, as do hints of purple flowers. It's lightly bodied on the sip, with light lavender touches, making for an easy quaff.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Santa Barbara Winery 2017 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied yet sour blackberry aromas are a bit tangy on the nose of this bottling, and are also lifted by hints of violet. The palate is slightly sour but smoothed out with boysenberry, aged meat, white-pepper and licorice flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vie Winery 2017 Les Amours Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This shows little sense of place or variety, but it's a tasty drop nonetheless, especially for the price. The nose is spicy and fruity, offering up enticing aromas of fresh cherry, plum, bay leaf, thyme and ground pepper. The palate is on the thin, astringent side but with just enough texture and tannin structure to keep the fruit in balance.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Layer Cake 2019 Shiraz (South Australia)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black-plum skins, lavender and a hint of balsamic berries show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tart and tangy with black plum, as complexity comes through with hints of thyme and black pepper.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Vie Winery 2017 White Hawk Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cedar and dark-plum aromas meet with crumpled herbs and a hint of charred game on the nose of this bottling. There are hints of asphalt and black pepper on the palate, but it's the woody, roasted plum element that is more dominant.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Meadowlark 2016 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of forest floor, brown stem, red apple and flower are followed by light, graceful fruit flavors. It's part intrigue, part delivery, with good things happening, but the concentration seems light.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mercer 2017 Reserve Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of cocoa, sweet barrel spice and red fruit. The palate is light but flavorful, tapering toward the blue fruit-filled finish. There's less concentration than the listed abv would suggest.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Boss Lady Adelaide AJ Mathison Estate Grown
Name: Stemilt Creek NV Boss Lady Adelaide AJ Mathison Estate Grown Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This is, hence the name, a drink-now style with no added sulfites. It's a clean wine but stylistically it feels confused, wanting, perhaps for more whole bunch or something to add more refreshment. Fruity and ripe, it leads with fleshy red berries, damp leaves, violet and a slight meaty note. The fruit on the palate feels somewhat heavy and syrupy even while the texture is thin with plenty of acidity. Tannins are soft but astringent and don't quite jell.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Paxton 2019 Now Made With Organic Grapes Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of plum and wood spice are followed by somewhat lighter-styled black pepper and plum flavors. The concentration seems a bit light at times, but what's there pleases.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: White Bluffs Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled
Name: Claar 2018 White Bluffs Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sta. Rita Hills, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly overextracted aromas of blackberry paste, raisin and root beer show on the nose of this bottling. It's similar on the palate, where those extract fruit tones meet with a crushed rock minerality.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lafond 2017 Lafond Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

Description: This is warm, ripe South Aussie Shiraz at an affordable price. It opens with dense, slightly woody aromas of cherry chocolate and blackberry jam backed by a bit of damp earth and savory spice. The plush fruit and chunky oak notes continue on the palate, where fruit feels a little stewed and tannins a bit astringent.                      Christina Pickard
Name: St Hallett 2018 Black Clay Shiraz (Barossa)

Appellation: Redwood Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Superripe and chocolaty in flavor, this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine offers raisin and dried plum notes topped with a dusty, sunbaked character.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Jigar 2017 Tollini Vineyard Syrah (Redwood Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried berries and light leather aromas show on the nose of this decade-old bottling. The palate is also leathery, with a hint of cracked pepper and woody palo santo flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Meadowlark 2009 Estate Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's still a bountiful rush of acidity on this nearly decade-old bottle, yet the age is showing in other ways. Aromas of very ripe yet leathery caramelized berry lead into a smoky, charred berry palate, with slightly bitter tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Meadowlark 2012 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This is a ripe, confected Shiraz with notes of blackberry jam and vanillin oak. The palate is disjointed, with a rush of acidity that somewhat sours the fruit. Slightly astringent tannins angle for space.                      Christina Pickard
Name: 3 Rings 2019 Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

Description: This earthy wine has tannins as well as black fruits. The wine's structure is perhaps too prominent at this stage, masking the red-fruit flavors. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2017 Bridão Syrah (Tejo)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This is a straightforward, somewhat synthetic Shiraz showing no sense of place or variety. Vague red fruit, peppery spice and a plastic-and-wood note lead to a palate that is thin and astringent, with some juicy fruit and tannins but little structure or depth.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yellow Tail 2019 Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This natural-style, low-alcohol wine has a funky, doughy, burnt-candy aroma and rather severe mouthfeel that holds cherry and cranberry flavors very tightly. It deserves a try, though, because it's made without added sulfites and may work out with time and the right, rich pairing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Donkey & Goat 2019 GiGi Sans Soufre Syrah (El Dorado)

Description: From a solid vintage in South Australia, this wine seamlessly weaves together notes of Italian plum, black cherry, mocha, cigar box and a plethora of herbs and spices. The palate is chiseled, all rippling, glistening muscles, but without the top heaviness. Ultrafine tannins cinch vibrant fruit while that cigar box element lingers on the lengthy finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penfolds 2016 Grange Shiraz (South Australia)

Description: From vines more than 120 years old at the higher altitudes of the Eden Valley, this wine is gorgeously balanced and open right from the get go. The pure, brambly fruit swirls with notes of licorice, baking spice, cracked pepper, black olive and the pan scrapings of a roast. The cooler climes really show on the palate where pristine acidity lifts the fruit to tangy territory, giving a linear shape to the wine. The tannins are chalky, spicy and superbly integrated. This could age until 2050 at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Powell & Son 2017 Steinart Shiraz (Eden Valley)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of black pepper, asphalt, charred beef and singed rosemary meet with delicate touches of purple flowers and ripe elderberries on the nose of this wild and complex bottling. Similar elements swirl across the palate, from roast lamb in elderberry compote to crumpled lavender and wild thyme.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bien Nacido Estate 2018 The XO Reserve Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

Description: From a site at 1,300 feet in elevation, this supercomplex, interesting and spicy wine dances in black and white pepper, dried fruit and iron notes. Structured and well integrated, it holds its power with grace and lasting elegance, showing an impressive alignment between site, variety and style.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hard Six Cellars 2017 Seven Pillars Jess' Block Syrah (Fort Ross-Seaview)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense aromas of roasted red currant, plum and blueberry meet with cocoa and coffee on the dark and thick nose of this bottling from the Pisoni Vineyard. Lavish and creamy tannins greet the palate and then show a more regal and rigid face, framing flavors of charred meat, rosemary, wild sage and iodine, with dark-berry fruit and brisk acidity washing into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lucia 2018 Susan's Hill Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from one of the state's top Syrah vineyards, the aromas explode from the glass, with notes of iron, bacon, earth and whiffs of orange peel along with blue and black fruit. Dense, intense rich fruit and savory flavors follow, showing weight and volume. But it's the exquisite balance that most impresses on this standout wine. Best after 2024.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Avennia 2018 Arnaut Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling explodes on the intense nose with aromas of seared lamb, iodine, purple flowers, rosemary and charcoal. The tar, char and asphalt flavors consume the grippy palate, with a core that ranges from raw, gamy meat to mace and eucalyptus before finishing on a streak of violet. Drink 2022–2040.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lucia 2018 Soberanes Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Description: From 110-year-old vineyards, this is classic premium Barossa Shiraz. It's open and expressive right from the first sniff. The nose is rich and heady, billowing cherry, chocolate, plum and licorice with a savory, earthy spine of bay leaf, mint and smoke. The tannins are granular and fine, framed by tangy, intense fruit and a stony mineral streak. Plush but linear and lifted, it should live on for decades. Drink through 2045.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Powell & Son 2017 Kraehe Marananga Shiraz (Barossa)

Description: The latest bottling of St. Henri, from a cool vintage, is a classic. Inky-hued, it's a deep well of flavor: plush blackberries, roasted vegtables, coffee beans, dark chocolate and a sanguine nuance. The palate is rich and mouthfilling but linear, with polished, spicy oak and fine, powerful tannins. It's a big wine that needs a major hit of protein if drinking now, but it will age beautifully for many decades to come. Drink through 2045.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penfolds 2017 St. Henri Shiraz (South Australia)

Description: Rich, intoxicating cassis and blackberry flavors throb from the core of this intensely ripe, stately Syrah that was aged 26 months in 50% new and 50% one-year-old oak. Full-bodied and lustrous yet anchored by a fine, mineral spray and firm, upright tannins, it's a wine that should gain complexity and definition through 2035 and likely hold longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Belle 2017  Hermitage

Description: Pulsating cassis and black cherry flavors drive this full-bodied, powerfully concentrated Syrah produced from 80% destemmed grapes. With less new-oak influence compared to the producer's La Sensonne, it's a deeply concentrated, luminous wine edged by firm, drying tannins. Approachable young but likely to improve through 2030 and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Coursodon 2016 Le Paradis Saint Pierre  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Delicate streaks of violet, wild mint and charred underbrush lend nuance to lustrous crème de cassis on the palate. It's intensely ripe but pure in fruit quality, lifted by a crystalline spine of minerality and very fine, lingering tannins. Lovely already but likely to improve through 2030 and hold for years further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Yann Chave 2017  Hermitage

Description: This impressive and complex wine is alluring from the first whiff through the lingering finish. It front-loads spicy, smoky, meaty aromas followed by rich, chewy, pomegranate, black-pepper and cocoa-nib flavors that are deep and delicious. A velvety blanket of fine grained tannins soothes the palate. Best from 2024 to 2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2015 Lytton Estate Syrah (Sonoma County)

Description: This impressive and complex wine is alluring from the first whiff through the lingering finish. It front-loads spicy, smoky, meaty aromas followed by rich, chewy, pomegranate, black-pepper and cocoa-nib flavors that are deep and delicious. A velvety blanket of fine grained tannins soothes the palate. Best from 2024 to 2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2015 Lytton Estate Syrah (Sonoma County)

Description: The Le Méal is a flagship plot of Hermitage, and this profoundly fruity yet firmly mineral Syrah is a fine example of the vineyard's greatness. Blackberry and black fig flavors are etched by nutmeg, bramble and sage. Aged 14–18 months in barrel (30–50% new oak), it's voluminous yet piercing and finishes on lingering, persistent tannins. A wine that should improve through 2035 and drink well longer still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Le Méal  (Hermitage)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Layers of crumpled violets and lavender float atop aromas of charcoal, Sichuan peppercorn, roasted coffee bean and thyme on the nose of this special bottling. There is decent heft to the palate, yet it is smooth in floral flavors and tannins that move from soft to firm across the tongue. Roasted berry and char flavors carry throughout.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: The Great Places August James Stolpman
Name: Stolpman 2018 The Great Places August James Stolpman Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

Description: Whiffs of granite and crushed violet petals align from nose to finish, lending vitality to rich, penetrating cassis and blackberry flavors. While medium-bodied in frame, it's a powerful wine speckled by smoke, ore and rich earth and held upright by fine, taut tannins. Just beginning to open now, it's a wine that should improve for decades to come.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: M. Chapoutier 2016 Les Clos  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Richly concentrated mulberry and blackberry flavors are kissed by smoke and charred earth in this smouldering old-vine beauty sourced from 60- to 80-year-old vines. It's medium bodied and crisply balanced but expands in lavish, silky waves on the palate. Bold, gripping tannins and a delicate black-tea astringency anchor a long finish. A wine with longevity that's just starting to show it's colors. Enjoy now–2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: M. Chapoutier 2016 Les Granits  (Saint-Joseph)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy, burly and brightly lifted by underlying acidity, this impressive wine is wild and complex. Moderate ripeness is highlighted by bold flavors of blueberry, dark cherry and dark chocolate. The richness is balanced and leads to an elegant finish of violet.                      Virginie Boone
Name: DuMOL 2018 Wild Mountainside Syrah (Russian River Valley)

Description: Though this producer's standard Crozes-Hermitage Syrah is a winner, too, older vines and longer maturation in large-format oak lends a richness and complexity to intense black cherry and cassis here. It's a gorgeously perfumed wine peppered by hints of dried mushroom, fur and violet candy. The finish is very long and lingers on alternating inflections of granite and blossom. Beautiful already but should improve through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine les 4 Vents 2016 Saint James  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Earthy, burly and brightly lifted by underlying acidity, this impressive wine is wild and complex. Moderate ripeness is highlighted by bold flavors of blueberry, dark cherry and dark chocolate. The richness is balanced and leads to an elegant finish of violet.                      Virginie Boone
Name: DuMOL 2018 Wild Mountainside Syrah (Russian River Valley)

Description: Richly concentrated mulberry and blackberry flavors are kissed by smoke and charred earth in this smouldering old-vine beauty sourced from 60- to 80-year-old vines. It's medium bodied and crisply balanced but expands in lavish, silky waves on the palate. Bold, gripping tannins and a delicate black-tea astringency anchor a long finish. A wine with longevity that's just starting to show it's colors. Enjoy now–2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: M. Chapoutier 2016 Les Granits  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Cassis and plum are decadently ripe in this gobsmacking Syrah sourced from clay and limestone soils. Aged 14–18 months in barrel, it's a rounded, richly textured wine shaded by tobacco, cedar and licorice. While a bit brawny in its youth, its cut mineral tones and invigorating acidic balance should help it gain elegance with age. At peak through 2035 but should hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Les Dionnières  (Hermitage)

Description: Sourced from 45-year-old Syrah vines, the single-vineyard Malfondieres offers a dramatic boost of intensity and complexity compared with the producer's (also lovely) Certitude bottling. Unctuous black cherry and plum flavors are shaded by earth and granite tones along with a whisper of cocoa powder and sweet spice. The finish is long and persistent, marked by firm, chalky tannins. Approachable in youth but concentrated enough to improve through 2027 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2017 Malfondieres  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Sturdy tannin and substantial structure join forces to reinforce this wine's savory density of garrigue, iron and black pepper—all accents of a muscular, grippy palate. Black raspberry and gamy meat persist further, pushing to a lengthy finish of crushed rock and lavender. Enjoy best from 2026 to 2031.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Donelan 2016 Obsidian Estate Syrah (Knights Valley)

Description: Matured up to 14 months in oak, this seductive, intensely blueberried Syrah is a rounder, more voluptuous wine than the producer's also-excellent Les Launes. Redolent of black figs, cinnamon and smoke, it's an opulent but elegantly composed wine with a long, luscious finish. At peak now–2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2016 Le Clos  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Shards of char, graphite and pepper shavings lend piquant, smoky edges to blackberry and cassis. A luscious, full-bodied expression of Saint-Joseph, it showcases deep, concentrated black-fruit against firm, bracing tannins and vital acidity. It's a bit tightly wound in youth but should meld gorgeously through 2030 and hold further still.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2017 Sainte-Épine  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: This polished, cellar-worthy Shiraz is made in open-top concrete vats from old vines in the Barossa and Eden Valleys. It's a spicy specimen, some of which seems fruit-derived and some from the oak. There's a heady combo of cedary, woodsy spice, with plump red and black berries, tobacco leaf and fistfuls of other dried herbs and spices. The palate is tautly wound by fine tannins, and even amidst all the spice, the fruit holds its own, pure and juicy. Currently showing quite a bit of oak, this could use another few years in bottle or plenty of protein if drinking now. It should go until 2040 at least.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Powell & Son 2017 Chatterton's Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

Description: Violet candy and smoky mineral tones introduce this penetrating Syrah. Ripe cassis and plum flavors are lifted by whispers of menthol and green peppercorn. Produced from 80% destemmed fruit and matured in oak for 16 months, it's a deeply complex, satisfying wine that's lovely in youth but likely to develop more earthen, animal nuances through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Emmanuel Darnaud 2017 La Dardouille  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: With greater depth and richness than Domaine Belle's other (also lovely) Crozes-Hermitage bottlings, the Roche Pierre is an intense, lavishly spiced Syrah marked by alluring notes of smoke, cinnamon and licorice. Matured in French oak for 24 months (30% new), it's a bold, intensely black-cherried sip framed by crisp acidity and a long, cocoa powder finish. Approachable in its youth but should improve through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Belle 2017 Roche Pierre  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Créme de cassis and mesquite swirl at the core of this sexy, sultry Syrah. Produced from fully destemmed grapes and matured in new oak, it's a bold, black cherried sip accented by hints of dark chocolate, tobacco leaf and clove. Decadent in concentration and framed by fine, supple tannins, it's a lavish wine that's ready to appreciate now but should up nicely through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Coursodon 2016 La Sensonne  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: This is a profoundly ripe, decadently concentrated expression of Syrah that straddles the lines between Crozes-Hermitage and it's more vaulted sibling, Hermitage. Plush, almost jammy black cherry and plum flavors are softened by hints of smoke, incense and clove. Velveteen in texture and wrapped in fine, pliant tannins, it's a wine that's ready now but should please well through 2026, likely longer.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: M. Chapoutier 2016 Les Varonniers  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Moon Mountain District Sonoma County, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the high-elevation climes of the appellation, this surly red is layered in black and white pepper, garrigue and leather notes. Remarkably balanced and restrained in ripeness, it offers an elegant framework of power and concerted, brambly fistfuls of blueberry and blackberry.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Anaba 2018 Bismark Vineyard Syrah (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)

Description: It's difficult to choose a favorite among Villard's excellent lineup of 2017 Saint-Joseph rouge. The Reflet, however, offers a purity of cassis flavor and vital acidic edge that's especially invigorating. It's fresh in fruit but accented by peppery green herbs, bramble and underbrush, too. Fine grained but gripping tannins accentuate it's longevity. Approachable now but should improve through 2030 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2017 Reflet  (Saint-Joseph)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling takes a bit of time to emerge on the nose, but once it does, it doesn't stop for days. Aromas of purple flowers, dark fruit and charred beef lead into a palate of roasted blackberry, charred black plum and cracked pepper. The tannins are firm but polished, ensuring a long life. Drink from 2022 to 2043.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lindquist Family 2018 Bien Nacido X Block Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from one of the state's top sites, Grenache makes up 55% of this wine, with the rest Syrah (37%) and Mourvèdre. Fermented in concrete and stainless steel, it offers a classic Boushey nose of bacon fat, dark raspberry, herb, mineral and earth. There's plenty of fruit flavors and structure, made in a rich, hedonistic style but with superb balance. Give it a short decant and it delivers the goods.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Devison 2018 Above the Flood Syrah (Yakima Valley)

Description: Zesty blackberry and cherry flavors are pristine in this medium-bodied Syrah fermented with 55% whole clusters. Aged 18 months in oak, it's a deeply black-fruited sip accented by fresh acidity and shades of green herb, pepper and olive. Persistent but fine-grained tannins are welcoming while young, but this should drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2017 Mairlant  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Hints of balsamic reduction, earth and smoke lend savory counterpoints to luscious flavors of dried plum and cherry compote. While deeply concentrated, it's held upright by a vibrant spine of acidity. A complex, solidly composed wine that's just reaching peak now and should drink beautifully for another decade.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Yannick Alléno & Michel Chapoutier 2016 Couronne de Chabot  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: This richly concentrated but oh-so-elegant Syrah is a stunner from first whiff, filling the glass with perfumed notes of dried violet and lilac, rose petal and plum. It's a full-bodied, opulent wine that highlights rich, ripe black fruit flavors against an undertone of dazzling granitic minerality. Fine, smooth tannins make it ready to drink now, but this should drink well through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2016 Les Launes  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is two-thirds Lawrence Vineyard fruit, with the rest coming from StoneTree. Fermented in concrete and oak uprights, the aromas bring immediate appeal, with notes of huckleberry, gunsmoke, dark raspberry, olive, crushed rock and smoked meat. There's a beautiful sense of depth, intensity and structure to the blue fruit, citrus and game flavors. A hyperextended finish caps it off. Decant if drinking in the near term.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Devison 2018 Phantom Lamb Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This inky, black-berried Syrah offers concentrated cassis flavor struck by cool, smoky tones of crushed granite, anise and violet perfume. Fermented from destemmed grapes and matured in 100% new oak, it's a slinky, sexy sip wrapped in layers of fine, gossamer tannins. Approachable now but likely to improve through 2035.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Coursodon 2017 La Sensonne  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Ebullient aromas of blackberry coulis, crushed pepper and violet introduce this hauntingly pretty Syrah sourced from 50-year-old vines. Made from 100% destemmed fruit and aged in 15 months en barrique (10–20% new), it's a glossy, intensely black-fruited sip wrapped in silky tannins. Irresistible in youth but should develop its more earthen, animal side as it matures through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Vallet 2017 Muletiers  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Soft and supple with a trace of grip, this lovely wine is juicy and exuberantly framed in burly black-fruit and forest notes. Lavender, garrigue and a trace of white pepper provide varietal complexity and lasting appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2017 Syrah (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Still one of the earliest vintages to come from this uniquely located estate on the mountainous southern edge of the appellation, this bottling shows strong aging potential. Aromas of blackberry, roasted blueberry, smoke and violet extract lead into a tightly wound, crisp palate of black raspberry, black pepper and bright acidity. Drink now through 2038.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Folded Hills 2018 Estate Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Blackberry and blueberry flavors are fleshy and sun-drenched but maintain a purity of fruit in this richly concentrated Syrah. Aged 14 months in two-year-old barriques, it's a warm, embracing sip peppered by hints of tobacco, fig and sweet spice. Feathery, persistent tannins linger on the finish. Approachable now but should improve through 2030 and hold further.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine des Remizières 2017 Cuvée Emilie  (Hermitage)

Description: Whiffs of saddle, smoke and earth lend a welcome rusticity to glossy plum preserves and cassis in this powerful Syrah sourced from 40-year-old vines. Matured en barrique (30% new), it's a lavish but elegantly composed wine that settles in long on the finish upon a blanket of soft, silky tannins. Ready now but should hold well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine des Remizières 2017  Saint-Joseph

Description: Blackberry and blueberry flavors are zesty and spry, accented by hints of peppery spice and bramble. Matured 18 months en barrique (30% new oak), it's a weighty, expansive Syrah but restrained and intently mineral. Though quiet in its youth, it should gain depth and power from 2030 and drink well for years beyond.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Denuzière 2017 J. Denuzière  (Hermitage)

Description: This lovely Syrah teases out classic violet and rose petal aromas alongside rich, concentrated flavors of cassis and blueberry preserves. Sourced from 30-year-old vines and 85% destemmed, it's a deeply ripe but freshly balanced wine with invigorating herb and floral notes that penetrate through a long finish. Best now–2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Éric & Jöel Durand 2017 Lautaret  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Matured in oak but with just 10% new barrels, Les Miaux is the most pure and unadulterated in fruit compared to the producer's more lavish Hermitage bottlings. Boysenberry and blackberry flavors are joyously plump but pristine, a lip smacking contrast to the tangs of cut stone that linger on the finish. Fine, firmly gripping tannins lend four-square structure. A stately yet approachable wine at peak now–2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Les Miaux  (Hermitage)

Description: This lovely Syrah teases out classic violet and rose petal aromas alongside rich, concentrated flavors of cassis and blueberry preserves. Sourced from 30-year-old vines and 85% destemmed, it's a deeply ripe but freshly balanced wine with invigorating herb and floral notes that penetrate through a long finish. Best now–2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Éric & Jöel Durand 2017 Lautaret  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Matured in oak but with just 10% new barrels, Les Miaux is the most pure and unadulterated in fruit compared to the producer's more lavish Hermitage bottlings. Boysenberry and blackberry flavors are joyously plump but pristine, a lip smacking contrast to the tangs of cut stone that linger on the finish. Fine, firmly gripping tannins lend four-square structure. A stately yet approachable wine at peak now–2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Les Miaux  (Hermitage)

Description: A favorite from Cave de Tain's excellent Terroirs d'Exception series focused on unique parcels of Crozes-Hermitage, the Nord bottling offers the same rich black cherry and blackberry flavors shared by its siblings, but with an elevated perfume that wafts of anise, violet and fur. It's piercing in fruit but nuanced by earth and flora, too. Ready now but should drink well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cave de Tain 2017 Terroirs d'Exception Nord  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Ventura County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is exciting because of its Ventura County roots, but also because it's a finely made, age-worthy wine. Aromas of dark plum, crumpled lilac, coffee and toast lead into a palate that's dense with charred meat, berry syrup and soy sauce flavors, with undulating waves of tannins. The umami factor is potent.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cavaletti 2018 Arianna Syrah (Ventura County)

Description: Heady layers of cocoa, cinnamon, anise and bramble intensify ripe, roasted black plum and cassis flavors. Matured in oak barrels for 16 months, it's a voluptuous, ample wine edged by fine, supple tannins. Ready to drink now but should maintain through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Emmanuel Darnaud 2017 Au Fil du Temps  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Ample, fleshy tones of blueberry and mulberry preserves abound in this weighty Syrah aged 14 months in oak Laurus barrels (new and used). It's a densely concentrated, almost cream-textured red accented by hints of smoke, nut and sandalwood. A fresh mineral undertone and firm, upright tannins guide a structured finish. Drinks well in its youth but should improve through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2017 Laurus  (Hermitage)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lighter in the glass than most Syrahs, this bottling offers white pepper, sage, patchouli, dried cherry and strawberry aromas on the nose. It's playful on the palate, with smashed plum and wild strawberry, yet there is a serious side, too, of smoked meat, dried thyme and a baking-spice finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kings Carey 2018 Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Luscious, mouthfilling flavors of blueberry and blackberry preserves are etched by hints of eucalyptus, iron and earth in this powerful Syrah sourced from 50-year-old organic vines. Matured 18 months in large-format oak barrels, it's a perfumed, glossy sip framed by smooth, supple tannins and pert acidity. At peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine les 4 Vents 2017 Saint James  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Pristine blueberry and plum notes are etched by a whisper of anise in this pertly balanced Syrah. Aged 12 months in neutral oak (50%) and concrete tanks (50%), it's a bright, zesty wine that elegantly offsets primary fruit against invigorating minerality. Lovely now but should drink well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine les Bruyeres 2017 Georges  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Sourced from high-altitude granite vineyards in full sun, this is an intensely ripe, almost jammy expression of Saint-Joseph. Accented by whispers of cacao, cinnamon and anise, it's a glossy, black-cherried sip framed by fine, chalky tannins and a kick of cassis acidity. A bold but elegant wine best enjoyed through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Michelas St Jemms 2017 Sainte Épine  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Smoke and cassis collide in this zippy, invigorating Syrah made from half destemmed fruit and matured 20 months in a combination of new, one-year-old and large-format barrels. At a slim-feeling 13.5% abv, it's a cutting, intensely mineral red that's appealing now but should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Tardieu-Laurent 2018 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Sultry veins of smoke and struck flint lend an earthen, savory appeal to glossy black currant in this deeply fruity but nuanced red. Fermented with 100% destemmed fruit and matured 18 months in new barriques, it's a fleshy, supple wine that finishes on a dense blanket of chalky tannins. Best now–2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pierre Gaillard 2017 Les Pierres  (Saint-Joseph)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas leap up, with notes of dark raspberry, black plum, smoked meat and whiffs of medicine. Rich flavors follow, with a silky feel upping the interest. It's guaranteed enjoyment. Give it a short decant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lydian 2018 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine offers oodles of plush, plump plum and cherry accented by flowers, peppery spice, soy and iron. The palate delivers what the nose suggests. It's broad shouldered but neatly cupped by fine, chalky tannins. There's a lucidity here thanks to minimal oak. Tangy fruit and a saline note carry the finish. It's a charming example of modern Barossa Shiraz.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Torbreck 2019 Woodcutter's Shiraz (Barossa Valley)

Description: Shards of crushed peppercorn and graphite lend spice and minerality to this beautifully ripe but restrained red. More linear in style than the producer's sultry La Sensonne or the more perfumed Le Paradis, it's a sharply edged, bracing Syrah that finishes on fine-grained, penetrating tannins. Best now–2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Coursodon 2017 L'Olivaie  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Pristine but intensely ripe blueberry and cassis are shaded by granite and menthol. It's a luscious, sultry Syrah balanced by brisk acidity that penetrates long on the palate. Fine, chalky tannins make it ready to enjoy now, but it should drink well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Mucyn 2017 Les Salamandres  (Saint-Joseph)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Though Bob Lindquist left the iconic Qupe brand that he founded decades ago, he is still making well-priced versions of savory Syrah. This appellation blend shows cracked pepper, crumpled lavender, black raspberry and iodine on the nose. The medium-bodied palate combines smoked meat and dried red fruit with sea salt and pepper spices.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lindquist Family 2019 Syrah (Central Coast)

Description: Scintillating wild raspberry and blackberry flavors penetrate through this effusively fruity but nuanced Syrah. Aged only partially in barrel (no new oak), it's a focused, primary wine marked by perfumed notes of lilac and rose petal and fine, feathery tannins. Ready now but should stay at peak through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Laurent Habrard 2016 Cuvée Valerie  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Inky in hue, this full-bodied, intensely penetrating Syrah offers profoundly ripe but pristine blackberry and blueberry flavors. It's a luscious, hedonistic expression of Crozes-Hermitage perfumed by whiffs of violet, bramble and black pepper and calibrated by crisp cassis acidity. Smooth, silky tannins make it ready to enjoy now, but it should hold through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Brotte 2017 La Rollande  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: The 2017 vintage of this Esprit de Granit offers notable depth and concentration. Matured 12 months in French oak, it's a luscious, open-knit wine packed with luscious plum preserves and cherry flavors along with heady accents of vanilla bean and toasted coconut. Soft, smooth tannins and a twist of bitter almonds square the finish. Ready now but should drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cave de Tain 2017 Esprit de Granit  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Savory strikes of dried thyme and bramble, crushed granite and iron mingle into rich, ripe flavors of blackberry jam and dried plum. Sourced from 30-year-old vines and aged 12 months in barriques (15% new) there's a richness and open-knit feel anchored by fresh acidity and a firm, mineral backbone. At peak now but should drink well through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Éric & Jöel Durand 2016 Lautaret  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Like this producer's La Rochette bottling, there's an invigorating freshness to black currant and cherry flavors in this ripe but cutting Syrah. Medium-bodied and zippy in style, it offers penetrating black fruit juxtaposed by perfumed swathes of violet florals, anise and tea leaves. A lovely wine that's enjoyable young but should drink at peak through 2025 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Jean-Claude et Nicolas Fayolle 2017 La Cuvée Nicolas  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: A kiss of char accents shades of vanilla and nutmeg in this medium-bodied Syrah matured predominantly in one- to three-year-old oak. Black cherry and cassis flavors are zesty and spry, lifted by a pristine mineral edge and firm, lingering tannins. Best now–2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2017 François de Tournon  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: This is a gorgeously perfumed Syrah that wafts of violet candy, cassis and blueberry preserves. On the palate, it's pristinely fruity, marked by crisp blackberry and plum flavors framed by earthen hits of bay leaf and raspy, lingering tannins. Ready now but should hold through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine François Merlin 2017 Les Grands Ducs  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: The 2017 vintage of this Esprit de Granit offers notable depth and concentration. Matured 12 months in French oak, it's a luscious, open-knit wine packed with luscious plum preserves and cherry flavors along with heady accents of vanilla bean and toasted coconut. Soft, smooth tannins and a twist of bitter almonds square the finish. Ready now but should drink well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cave de Tain 2017 Esprit de Granit  (Saint-Joseph)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An inaugural release, the aromas aren't ready to reveal their charms on first pour. Red fruit, plum, bramble, blood orange and dried herb notes emerge over time. The palate is rich, textured, layered and ripe but still well in check, with orange peel notes on the finish. The purity of it all captivates.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Quiddity 2018 Audentes Syrah (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: Traces of smoked nut, leather and vanilla introduce this concentrated, profoundly ripe Syrah sourced from 70-year-old vines and aged 12 months en barrique. It's a more voluptuous, enveloping expression of Syrah than this producer's other Crozes-Hermitage offerings but pertly balanced by fresh acidity and fine, persistent tannins. A heartier red that should improve through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fayolle Fils & Fille 2016 Clos les Cornirets  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Purple and red flowers, boysenberry, light vanilla and a touch of wood ash show on the nose of this bottling. There's an elegant floral array on the palate, full of violet, lilac and elderflower, as well as black plum and (on the finish) sandalwood.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bottle Jack 2017 Camel Hill Vineyards Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Crème de cassis and blackberry jam abound in this opulent, full-throttled Syrah. It's a deep, penetrating sip lifted by zesty acidity and lingering hints of crushed earth and iron. Fine, polished tannins make it approachable in youth, but there's plenty of substance here to allow it to drink well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cave de Tain 2017 Terroirs d'Exception SA  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: This is an intensely ripe yet pertly balanced Syrah offering perfumed notes of preserved black cherry, smoke and anise. Plump on the palate but brightened by fresh acidity, it's an easy drinking but elegant red that should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Christelle Betton 2017 Caprice  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: There's a boost in ripeness and concentration here compared with the producer's Premier Regard Crozes-Hermitage. Black plum and cassis have a density and inkiness on the palate accented by complexities of earth, smoke and granite. Fresh acidity lends balance to the finish along with lingering notes of menthol and dried violet. A lovely wine that's at peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Melody 2017 Etoile Noire  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Enticing lilac perfume is accented by smoky shades of hazelnuts and crushed granite on the nose of this Syrah. Aged entirely in neutral, old barriques for 11 months, there's a purity of black cherry and cassis flavors on the palate accented by crisp acidity and a cutting mineral finish. Best enjoyed through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Vallet 2017 Meribets  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Enticing notes of violet, licorice and bramble perfume this beautifully lithe Syrah. Fermented with 80% whole clusters, it's a concentrated but freshly composed red etched by veins of green herb, menthol and peppery spice. Ready to drink now but should improve through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2017 Poivre et Sol  (Saint-Joseph)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine was fermented 25% whole cluster and aged in puncheon (50% new). The aromas pop in notes of flower, herb and plum. The flavors are fresh and light, with plentiful coffee accents. It brings a compelling sense of intensity, freshness and balance.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Grosgrain 2018 XL Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Epic cool-climate aromas of peppercorn, gamy roasted meats, tar and iodine show strongly on the nose of this bottling. There is a firm tannic trip to the sip, where pine-needle, smoked meat, black-plum and elderberry flavors converge.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Integrity 2018 Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Heady aromas of lavender, lilac and clove perfume this inky, intensely fruit-forward expression of Hermitage. While more open and approachable in its youth than most Syrah from this appellation, it's elegantly structured, too, held upright by tangs of cut stone and taut, persistent tannins. At peak now–2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Louis Bernard 2017  Hermitage

Description: A firm granite undertone and hints of smoke and incense lend gravitas to juicy, thirst-quenching black cherry and blackberry flavors in this elegant Syrah sourced from biodynmically farmed vines. Fine, supple tannins make it welcoming in its youth, but it should drink well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: M. Chapoutier 2017 Les Meysonniers  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: While earthen aromas of smoke and nut are demure upon first opening, time and aeration coax out pristine, cutting blackberry and raspberry. Sourced from 30- to 40-year-old vines, it's a piercing, medium-bodied Syrah that balances invigorating acidity and fine, firm tannins against a vibrant fruit profile. At peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Philippe & Vincent Jaboulet 2016  Crozes-Hermitage

Description: Lavish aromas of vanilla bean, chocolate shavings and clove adorn this rich, rounded Syrah aged 12 to 14 months in oak (10% new). It's a decadent, glossy Saint-Joseph but balanced neatly with pert acidity and lingering hints of fur, smoke and cured meats. Approachable in youth but bold enough to drink well past 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Lieu-Dit Bonneveau  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Sourced from high altitude slopes of decomposed granite, this intensely ripe, luscious Syrah offers richly concentrated flavors of crème de cassis and black cherry compote. Aged in oak (just 10% new) for 12 to 14 months, it's a softly edged, supple wine accented by flickering hints of cocoa powder, vanilla and smoke. Fine, lingering tannins accentuate its plush feel. Ready now but should hold through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Lieu Dit  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Leathery in texture and brimming in dark, brooding and brambly black fruit, this wine is ultimately impressive in structure and balanced weight, allowing the savory components to stand out. Black pepper, garrigue and a note of oak guide it to a cohesive finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Flanagan 2018 Syrah (Bennett Valley)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Black olives accent the sweet heat going on in this generously ripe, lush and rounded wine, which is voluptuous in style. A touch of garrigue and lavender give it varietal complexity and lasting appeal.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Eleven Eleven 2017 Destin Estate Syrah (Oak Knoll District)

Description: Boldly concentrated black cherry and plum flavors are nuanced by hints of green olive, cacao and bitter almonds. Sourced from younger vines and with less stem inclusion than the producer's Lautaret bottling, it's a fresh, juicy wine ruffled in velvety tannins and finishing on a long, mineral edge. Ready now but should hold through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Éric & Jöel Durand 2017 Les Coteaux  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Intensely ripe, almost inky on the palate, this is a voluptuous Syrah that introduces itself with heady whiffs of clove, dark chocolate and fig. Black plum and cherry flavors are penetrating on the palate but calibrated neatly by pert acidity and plush, easing tannins. Aged in large oak barrels for eight months, it's a hedonistic but immediately approachable wine that should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Calendes  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Fresh, penetrating mulberry and cassis flavors are accented by savory notes of bramble and herb. It's an intensely ripe, gorgeously fruity Syrah edged by a fringe of bitters and firm, chalky tannins. Drinks well already but should maintain well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: François Villard 2017 Certitude  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Matured 15 months in the large-format Laurus barrels traditional to the region, this is an opulent, smoky Syrah that juxtaposes bold blackberry and cassis flavors against layers of toast, vanilla and caramel. It's an opulent but elegant wine that's approachable in youth yet should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2017 Laurus  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Hints of forest floor, char and smoke lend an earthen tone to ripe blackberry and cassis flavors. Slim in profile and etched by a whiff of horse saddle, it's an elegant expression of Saint-Joseph that embraces rusticity, too. Bright fruit and velveteen tannins make it ready now–2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2017 Saint-Etienne  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Perfumed whiffs of violet candy and cassis introduce this vibrant, slender expression of Syrah. Medium-bodied and restrained in style, it offers a cutting black fruit quality framed by fine, upright tannins and a peppery finish. It's ready now but should drink at peak through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Jean-Claude et Nicolas Fayolle 2017 La Rochette  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Hints of forest floor, char and smoke lend an earthen tone to ripe blackberry and cassis flavors. Slim in profile and etched by a whiff of horse saddle, it's an elegant expression of Saint-Joseph that embraces rusticity, too. Bright fruit and velveteen tannins make it ready now–2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2017 Saint-Etienne  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Perfumed whiffs of violet candy and cassis introduce this vibrant, slender expression of Syrah. Medium-bodied and restrained in style, it offers a cutting black fruit quality framed by fine, upright tannins and a peppery finish. It's ready now but should drink at peak through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Jean-Claude et Nicolas Fayolle 2017 La Rochette  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: This is quite a pretty, silken Syrah redolent of violets and boasting a fresh, forward palate full of sweet-tart blackberries and blueberries. Soft in tannins and delicately textured, it's best enjoyed in its youth but should hold well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Yann Chave 2017 Le Rouvre  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Crisp acidity lifts a palate that's bright and fruity in pomegranate and strawberry in this refined, lengthy red. Blended with 7% Petite Sirah as well as 5% Mourvèdre, it shows the appellation's cooler-climate tendencies in a mix of garrigue and white pepper that pops on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Crux 2017 Syrah (Russian River Valley)

Description: Whispers of vanilla, licorice and hazelnut mingle into zesty blackberry and raspberry in this medium-bodied, concentrated red. It's an elegant Syrah balanced by crisp acidity and just a hint of horse saddle lending a rustic touch. Fine-grained tannins make it approachable in youth. At peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Yannick Alléno & Michel Chapoutier 2017 Guer-Van  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Whiffs of chocolate and sweet spice accent plush, concentrated flavors of preserved plum and black cherry. Aged eight to 10 months in barrel, it's a boldly fruity red shadowed by hints of smoke and cocoa powder. Fresh acidity lifts the finish. An approachable wine with soft, powdery tannins that's ready now but substantial enough to hold through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Les Pichères  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Crushed bay leaves and black peppercorns lend a smoky, earthen tone to crisp blackberry. Zesty black fruit flavors and firm, fine-grained tannins lend a sharp, linear feel to the palate. The finish is marked by hints of green herb and olive. Ready now but should improve through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Bouachon 2017  Saint-Joseph

Description: Rich layers of dark chocolate and vanilla penetrate from nose to palate in this lavishly ripe Syrah matured 12 months in French oak. Black cherry and cassis flavors are bold and juicy on the palate but balanced by a zippy acidic backbone and fine, chalky tannins. It's a wine that's welcoming in its youth but should drink at peak through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Clairmont 2017 Domaine Defrance Le Chemin  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: This is an impressively rich wine, packed with black fruit and dense, spicy tannins. It shines in its richness, juicy, full of fruitiness and with a considerable future ahead of it. The aftertaste, perfumed and minty from the new wood, gives it another boost towards aging. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Colinas do Douro 2018 Quinta da Extrema Syrah (Duriense)

Description: Pert, peppery tannins contrast plush cassis and blueberry flavors in this fruity, forward Syrah. It's a ripe, juicy sip but anchored by crisp acidity and swathes of fresh thyme and wild mint on the finish. Ready to enjoy now but should hold through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine François Merlin 2017  Saint-Joseph

Description: Bright, fresh black cherry and raspberry flavors are zesty and spry in this Syrah. It's a juicy, fruity sip calibrated by vibrant acidity and pleasantly leafy, herbal nuance. Just a hint of horse saddle lends welcome rusticity. Enjoy now–2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Yannick Alléno & Michel Chapoutier 2017 Croix de Chabot  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Intensely sunny but pristine notes of wild blackberry and blueberry preserves abound in this rich, concentrated red. It's a juicy, boldly fruity Syrah but nuanced, too, by hints of anise, dried sage and nutmeg. Aged 12 months in French oak, it's an open-knit, fleshy sip that finishes on soft, chalky tannins. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Clairmont 2017 Domaine de Saint-Clément Le Pierrier  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: This is a supple, welcoming Syrah marked by plush black cherry and preserved plum flavors accented by hints of incense and sweet spice. Aged four years in used oak, it's a broad-shouldered, juicy wine framed by fine, soft tannins. At peak now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Combier 2017 Cap Nord Laurent Combier  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Rich, open-knit plum and preserved-cherry flavors are shaded by hints of earth, ore and violet in this ripe, creamy Syrah. Aged 15 months in barriques (70% new and 30% one-year-old oak), it's a decadent, oakier expression of Crozes-Hermitage than most but elegantly composed. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine des Remizières 2017 Cuvée Christophe  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Piercing black currant and plum abound from nose to palate in this richly concentrated, stately red. Sourced from 30-year-old vines and aged 15 months in large-format barrels, it's a more penetrating expression of the appellation than the producer's entry-level Crozes-Hermitage. Accented by hints of peppery spice and persistent, chalky tannins, it's a solid Syrah that should drink well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Pradelle 2017 Les Hirondelles  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Sourced from organically farmed vines averaging over 70 years in age, there's a rich, pulsating core of blackberry and cassis flavors here that you may not find in the producer's less expensive Crozes-Hermitage bottlings. Black fruit flavors are ripe but sharply edged and accented by savory hints of wild mint and oregano. Ready to enjoy now but should hold through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fayolle Fils & Fille 2017 Clos les Cornirets  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Exuberantly fruity and redolent of smoke, spice and chocolate, this is a lavish but elegantly composed Syrah sourced from vines averaging over 50 years old. Matured 10 months in oak barrels (no new oak), it's an open-knit, luscious wine layered with soft, chalky tannins that linger on the finish. At peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Olivier Dumaine 2017 La Croix du Verre  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Intensely forward, blueberry and black cherry flavors take center stage in this juicy, fruity Syrah. It's a decadently ripe, rounded sip but balanced neatly by crisp acidity and a frame of taut, bracing tannins. Ready now but should hold well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Duvernay 2017  Saint-Joseph

Description: Blackberry and raspberry flavors are ripe but exhibit elegant restraint throughout this smoky, intensely mineral Syrah. It's a medium-bodied, freshly structured Syrah framed by very fine, persistent tannins. A subtle but invigorating wine finishing on a peppery twist at peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Emmanuel Darnaud 2017 Les Trois Chênes  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Perfumed and unctuous, this richly textured Syrah is packed to the gills with sun-drenched black cherry and mulberry flavors. Matured for 10 to 14 months in oak, it's a glossy, lavish sip shaded by hints of smoke, nut and licorice. Fresh acidity and polished tannins make it a four-square pick that should maintain peak through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2017 Le Clos  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Hints of lilac lend a floral perfume to pert blackberry and plum in this juicy, penetrating red. Made entirely from destemmed fruit and matured only partially in oak, it's a forward, intently fruity Syrah that welcomes youthful drinking but should hold well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2017 Les Challeys  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Layers of violet and lavender perfume permeate this elegant, almost lithe, Syrah sourced from 30- to 40-year-old Syrah. Matured only partially in large-format oak, it's a beautifully linear, fruit-focused wine that pulsates with crisp blackberry and cassis flavors. Drinking beautifully now but should hold through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine les 4 Vents 2016  Crozes-Hermitage

Description: Unoaked and piercing in style, this freshly composed Syrah offers juicy black cherry and tart blueberry flavors edged by whiffs of crushed stone and dried mushroom. It's an excellent value for a such a solid wine and likely to drink well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Louis Bernard 2016  Crozes-Hermitage

Appellation: McDowell Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Well-concentrated blackberry-jam aromas lead to ripe, vibrant black-cherry and dark-chocolate flavors in this full-bodied, moderately tannic wine made from un-irrigated old vines. It's big and hearty, great to pair with juicy protein dishes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Marietta Cellars 2017 Gibson Block Estate Grown Syrah (McDowell Valley)

Description: Veins of pastry, vanilla and clove mingle into densely packed black cherry and plum preserves on the nose and palate of this luscious red. It's a voluminous, mouthfilling Syrah accentuated by fine, glossy tannins and a juicy, lingering finish. Ready now but should drink well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Cave de Tain 2017 Terroirs d'Exception LA  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Sens is this producer's homage to Syrah in a pure, unoaked form, and the 2016 offers luminous blackberry and raspberry flavors perfumed by swathes of lilac, rose petal and olive. It's a juicy, vibrantly fruity wine lifted by crisp acidity and framed by fine, taut tannins. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Fayolle Fils & Fille 2016 Sens  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Sun-scorched bramble and wild raspberries are etched by shards of dark chocolate and graphite in this rich, slightly ruddy expression of Saint-Joseph. It's a sultry, satiny sip drenched in sunny berry and cherry flavors and a finish coated by fine, cocoa powder tannins. Ready now but should drink well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Lieu-Dit Paradis  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: This slim, very linear Syrah offers piercing blackberry and black currant flavors perfumed by swathes of green peppercorn, violet and ore. Made from 100% destemmed grapes, it's an elegant, fresh-fruited Saint-Joseph that finishes long on fine, chalky tannins. Best now–2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Louis Bernard 2017  Saint-Joseph

Description: Dried black cherry and violet candies perfume this slim, freshly composed Syrah. Silky on the tongue but framed by brisk acidity and fine-grained, persistent tannins, it's a finessed wine that should hold well through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Denuzière 2017  Saint-Joseph

Description: Piercing flavors of boysenberry and crème de cassis throb at the core of this ripe but really elegant Syrah sourced from high altitude granite slopes. It's gorgeously fruity but etched by earthen tones of bramble, bay leaf and crushed olives, too. Brisk acidity and fine, taut tannins brace the finish. Lovely now but should hold well through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Vignobles Verzier 2017 Empreinte  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Bright and quaffable, this easy-drinking but elegant Syrah is packed with flavors of raspberry sorbet and red cherry preserves. Lifted by sprays of lavender and lilac perfume, it's a full-bodied but briskly concentrated wine with a lean, herbal edge on the finish. Best now–2025 to enjoy its pure, fruity goodness.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2016 Les Challeys  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: While initially quite earthen and smoky, aeration coaxes out lovely black cherry and spiced plum notes from this full-bodied, unctuous Syrah. Plush and primary, it's lovely in its youth for its sunny demeanor and fine, velveteen tannins but concentrated enough to hold well through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Coursodon 2016 L'Olivaie  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Swathes of violet, lilac and bramble perfume this profoundly juicy, succulent red sourced from young, organically farmed Syrah. Unoaked and medium-bodied in style, it's an irresistibly fruit-forward but elegant wine framed by soft, chalky tannins. At peak now but should hold well through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine les 4 Vents 2017 Les Pitchounettes  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Campo de Borja, Northern Spain, Spain
Description: Grapy black-fruit aromas are gamy and suggestive of wet animal hide. A big, jammy palate is braced by oak and tannins, while this meaty Syrah tastes woody and baked, with fully ripe blackberry flavors. Lemony oak residuals are found on a charred finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Borsao 2016 Zarihs Syrah (Campo de Borja)

Description: Balsamic notes of camphor mingle with ripe black-skinned berry, leather and Mediterranean brush aromas. The firm palate offers cassis and star anise alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. It closes on a coffee bean note. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Maccari 2017 Maharis Syrah (Sicilia)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Roasted coffee bean, char and dark chocolate aromas are at the fore. The palate brings sumptuousness, but also deftness, showing pleasing detail. A warm finish caps it off.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Fielding Hills 2017 Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Wisps of toast and smoked hazelnuts accent ripe but restrained blackberry and plum flavors in this squarely balanced, medium-bodied Syrah. While concentrated in black fruit, it's a cutting, mineral wine that finishes with a bracing edge of fine-grained, lingering tannins. Ready now–2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Gabriel Meffre 2017 Laurus  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Sultry streaks of cassis liqueur and preserved plums are accented by hints of anise and smoke in this plump, sexy Syrah. Richly concentrated and fringed by ripe, yielding tannins, it's a boldly fruity, spicy sip to enjoy now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Laurent Habrard 2017 Cuvée Kévin  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine was bottled in 2015 and was given an additional five years in bottle prior to release. Coming from the state's coolest vintage on record, it is still lively, in a sweet spot. Aromas of coconut, baking spice and dried dark fruit are followed by a smooth palate, full of nougat flavors. Drink now.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Wanaka 2011 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Smoky, gamy meat and lavender complement each other as this bold wine forms a foundation of thick, sweet vanilla richness and dense notes of black cherry and blackberry. Well made, the style is undeniably opulent.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Darioush 2018 Shiraz (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Southern Oregon is proving to be a welcoming home for Syrah. Here, the mix of blueberries and blackberries is enhanced with a wash of vanilla cream and espresso. It's a winning flavor profile that keeps the herbal side of the grape in check. Aeration or decanting is highly recommended.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Del Rio 2017 Syrah (Rogue Valley)

Description: Among this producer's line up of excellent Saint-Joseph bottlings, the Silice offers the most straightforward, fruity enjoyment. Bright black cherry and mulberry flavors are ripe but pristine, held upright by fine-grained, silky tannins and pert cassis acidity. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Coursodon 2017 Silice  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: This vintage is characterful and lucid, with lovely purity to the lifted red fruit. Light weight compared to other reds from this producer, this nonetheless offers powerful tannins amidst bright fruit. It's polished but not masked by too much oak. This is an affordable weeknight red that makes for a crowd pleasing tipple.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Wirra Wirra 2018 Scrubby Rise Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

Description: Hints of hazelnuts, dried herbs and underbrush lend savory undertones to ripe, concentrated boysenberry and cassis. It's a full-bodied, accessibly juicy wine but anchored by crisp acidity and an elegant, earthen spine. Smooth, glossy tannins are welcoming in youth. At peak now–2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Melody 2017 Premier Regard  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Cool strikes of granite and graphite extend from nose to finish in this intensely mineral, medium-bodied Syrah. It's a zesty wine marked by crisp blackberry and cherry flavors and a backbone of bristling acidity. Gripping tannins frame the finish. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Les Alexandrins 2017  Saint-Joseph

Description: Initial notes of earth and smoke on the nose dissipate with time and aeration revealing ripe, luscious black cherry and plum preserves. Medium-bodied but richly textured on the palate, it's an ample, intensely fruity Syrah anchored by an elegant frame of granite and acidity. Ready now but should hold through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pierre Gaillard 2017  Crozes-Hermitage

Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut and blue flower lead the nose along with a whiff of eucalyptus. The densely concentrated palate also has a weightless quality, offering ripe black plum, blackberry jam and licorice alongside bright acidity and fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2018 La Monaca Syrah (Monreale)

Description: Crisp black cherry and cassis flavors are freshly concentrated in this smoky, intensely mineral Syrah. Matured in a combination of oak (no new) and stainless steel, it's a more restrained, stony expression of Saint-Joseph than the producer's fresh-fruited Challeys or the more voluptuous Sainte-Épine. At peak now–2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Delas Frères 2016 François de Tournon  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Cool strikes of granite and graphite extend from nose to finish in this intensely mineral, medium-bodied Syrah. It's a zesty wine marked by crisp blackberry and cherry flavors and a backbone of bristling acidity. Gripping tannins frame the finish. Best now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Maison Les Alexandrins 2017  Saint-Joseph

Description: Initial notes of earth and smoke on the nose dissipate with time and aeration revealing ripe, luscious black cherry and plum preserves. Medium-bodied but richly textured on the palate, it's an ample, intensely fruity Syrah anchored by an elegant frame of granite and acidity. Ready now but should hold through 2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Pierre Gaillard 2017  Crozes-Hermitage

Description: This is a spicy, juicy Shiraz that wears its heart on its sleeve, with outpourings of blackberry jam, plum cake and chocolate alongside heaps of spice, olive and bay leaf. There's a spine of dusty oak that's present but not intrusive. The palate is austere and tightly wound in chalky tannins. Drink now with protein until 2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Chapel Hill 2018 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

Description: While the nose suggests crisp blackberry and plums, the palate of this full-bodied Syrah is quite ripe, almost ruddy. Black plum and cherry flavors are luscious and open but edged by hints of bitter cacao and soft, fine tannins. At peak already but should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Belle 2017 Les Pierrelles  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Intensely ripe, luscious flavors of raspberry preserves and plum compote are juxtaposed by charred earth and autumn leaves in this oak-aged Syrah made from 100% destemmed fruit. It's an approachably fruity, plush red but kept on its toes by a zesty acidic edge and fine-grained, upright tannins. At peak now–2025.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Coursodon 2016 Silice  (Saint-Joseph)

Description: Seductive hints of fur and crushed earth lend complexity to ripe, pristine blackberry and cassis in this medium-bodied, delicately tannic Syrah. Aged 13 months in French barriques (no new oak), it's a richly textured but freshly concentrated wine with a lingering licorice kiss on the finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine de la Ville Rouge 2017 Terre d'Eclat  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Profoundly ripe, primary flavors of blackberry and cherry abound in this juicy, full-bodied Syrah. Aged 12 months in barrel, it's a rounded, velvety sip marked by prominent accents of pepper, cardamom and cinnamon but brightly balanced in acidity, too. Soft, easy tannins make it ready to drink now, but this should hold through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Domaine Michelas St Jemm 2017 La Chasselière  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: Concentrated notes of dried black cherry and plum are underscored by coffee, crushed black pepper and anise in this medium-bodied but richly textured red. Aged 12 to 14 months in oak (20–30% new), it's a rounded, open expression of Syrah layered in chalky, persistent tannins. Brisk acidity brightens a long finish. Ready now but should drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Ferraton Père et Fils 2017 Le Grand Courtil  (Crozes-Hermitage)

Description: An invigorating granite edge persists in this medium-bodied, freshly concentrated Syrah. Sourced from vines aging over 25 years and aged 14 months in oak (30% new), it balances brisk blackberry and boysenberry flavors against nuances of char, graphite and smoke.
